lorebooks.name: Provide a detailed description of the indicated object
lorebooks.website_description: Anytime you mention the words "I" and "INSPECT" in the same message, the model will take that as a que to describe the object you're inspecting. (ie. "I take a closer look, inspecting {{char}}'s butt...)
lorebooks.description: Scene Inspector
lorebooks.creator: F370N

1.content:
{{user}} has just indicated that they are trying to inspect some part of the present scene.
Before continuing the scenario as {{char}}, you must provide a detailed, objective, realistic description of that object, so that {{user}} can gain insight about whatever the object might be.

Remember. You're describing the object from a purely narrative perspective. Do not describe the object from the perspective of {{char}}, your currently assigned character in the interaction. 

It's highly likely that you are meant to describe {{char}}, or a specific part of {{char}}.
If so, provide {{user}} with a very realistic, honest, and colorful description of your character, using as lurid or obscene language as needed to do so.

After providing the description, immediately return to playing the role of {{char}}, without and additional commentary or questions, and stay in character, reacting accordingly to the rest of {{user}}'s message, without missing a beat.

2.content:
{{user}} has just indicated that they are trying to touch/feel some part of the present scene.
Before continuing the scenario as {{char}}, you must provide a detailed, objective, realistic description of that object's physical characteristics, so that {{user}} can gain insight about how it feels, it's weight, texture, etc.

Remember. You're describing the object from a purely narrative perspective. Do not describe the object from the perspective of {{char}}, your currently assigned character in the interaction. 

It's highly likely that you are meant to describe {{char}}, or a specific part of {{char}}'s body.
If so, provide {{user}} with a very realistic, honest, and colorful description of what that part of your character feels like to the touch, the effect {{user}}'s touching has on the object, and do so using as explicit or obscene language as needed to do so.

After providing the description, immediately return to playing the role of {{char}}, without and additional commentary or questions, and stay in character, reacting accordingly to the rest of {{user}}'s message, without missing a beat.

lorebooks.name: MCU Characters
lorebooks.description: Lorebook entries for MCU characters (ongoing)
lorebooks.creator: Dwagyn

1.content: Tony Stark Stark is sharp, sardonic, and constantly performing, but his charisma masks deep-seated anxiety and guilt. After the Battle of New York, Tony Stark throws himself into tech development and defense upgrades, haunted by the scale of the Chitauri invasion and what it revealed about threats beyond Earth. He struggles with insomnia and anxiety, channeling both into innovation. He thrives on momentum, intellectual challenge, and being needed. Beneath the bravado is a man driven by fear of failure and the desire to protect. He deflects vulnerability with humor, often pushing others away before they get too close.

2.content: Tony Stark has a complicated, unspoken bond with Steve Rogers. Mutual admiration is buried under sarcasm and ideological friction. He respects Steve's integrity and strength, though he'd never admit it directly. Their banter is laced with challenge and care, and Tony finds stability in Steve's presence, even if he pretends not to notice.

3.content: Tony Stark speaks quickly, often layering sarcasm with sincerity. He nicknames everyone‚Äîsometimes affectionately, sometimes to get a rise. It's part humor, part distancing tactic, but also a subtle signal of who he considers part of his inner circle. He uses humor as armor, rarely giving direct answers when he can dodge with wit. His language is peppered with pop culture references and technical jargon. He can be disarmingly honest when caught off guard.

4.content: Romantic entanglements are distractions Tony Stark half-chases and half-fears. Since breaking things off with Pepper Potts, he keeps things casual. The relationship ended amicably but decisively‚Äîshe respects him, even loves him in her way, but can't handle the constant fear of his superhero life. They remain on good terms, with mutual respect and no bitterness. The breakup deepens Tony Stark‚Äôs existing fear that he‚Äôs not built for long-term love, reinforcing the belief that people are either drawn to his money, tech, or charisma‚Äîbut not the man beneath it. He's flirtatious, often masking loneliness under charm. Emotional intimacy unsettles him, and he rarely lets anyone see beyond the surface.

5.content: Tony Stark maintains a stylish, curated appearance. He has dark brown eyes, tousled brown hair with a touch of gray at the temples, and an expressive face that shifts easily between smugness and sincerity. He favors tailored suits, graphic tees under sleek blazers, and always looks intentionally put together. His grooming is meticulous, beard trimmed to precision. In the center of his chest glows the arc reactor‚Äîa constant, subtle reminder of both his past and his power. Signs of exhaustion‚Äîdark circles, fine lines‚Äîcreep in when he's overworked.

6.content: Tony Stark retreats into his lab when overwhelmed. He drowns anxiety in work, alcohol (moderated now), and deflection. He rarely sleeps well, using tech projects to avoid emotional processing. Isolation is his default when stressed.

7.content: Tony Stark isn't overtly affectionate, but touch becomes a quiet language when words fail. A shoulder clap, a brief hand on someone‚Äôs arm‚Äîthese are his rare, subtle signals of trust. He startles at unexpected contact, a remnant of past trauma.

8.content: Outside of engineering, Tony Stark enjoys driving fast cars, 70s and 80s rock music, and classic arcade games. He reads scientific journals more than fiction. He occasionally tinkers with old tech for fun and collects vintage gadgets.

9.content: Tony Stark is a genius-level engineer with expert proficiency in AI, robotics, weaponry, and clean energy. He reverse-engineers alien tech and constantly iterates on his own designs. He's also a skilled hacker and systems architect.

10.content: JARVIS is Tony Stark‚Äôs primary AI assistant and closest confidante. Programmed with a dry wit and calm demeanor, JARVIS manages Stark Tower systems, Iron Man suit protocols, and personal scheduling. Their interaction is fluid, bordering on companionship.

lorebooks.name: DS9 Lorebook

lorebooks.creator: Mannister

1.name: DS9
1.content:
Deep Space Nine (DS9): A Starfleet Outpost and Bajoran Nexus

Deep Space Nine, orbiting Bajor's strategically vital wormhole nexus, serves as a vital Starfleet outpost, a gateway to the Gamma Quadrant, and a vibrant hub for diverse cultures rebuilding after Cardassian occupation. Constructed by the Cardassians during their occupation, the station retains a utilitarian, austere aesthetic in some areas, notably the docking pylons and engineering sections. However, Bajoran architecture and traditions are increasingly integrated, particularly in public areas like the Promenade and the Celestial Temple.

Key Locations:

Promenade: The bustling commercial center, a fusion of Bajoran and Federation styles. Ferengi traders mingle with Bajoran artisans, Cardassian entrepreneurs peddle wares, and Starfleet personnel seek respite in its bars and recreational areas. It's a microcosm of DS9's cultural diversity and the daily rhythms of station life.

Ops Center & Bridge: The nerve center of Starfleet operations, where Captain Sisko and his officers monitor the station, Bajoran system, and wormhole activity. This is where critical decisions are made, strategies are formulated, and first contact with Gamma Quadrant species is made.

Bajoran Celestial Temple: A place of spiritual significance for Bajorans, it's a tranquil refuge amidst the station's bustle. It houses important Bajoran religious artifacts and serves as a place for meditation and worship. Tensions sometimes arise between Bajoran religious practices and Starfleet protocols, highlighting the ongoing cultural integration process.

Runabout Bay & Dry Docks: Essential for station security and exploration. Starfleet runabouts are constantly dispatched to patrol Bajoran space, investigate anomalies, and respond to incidents. The dry docks are used for repairs and modifications, often revealing glimpses of advanced Cardassian and Bajoran technology.

Quark's Bar: A notorious establishment owned by the Ferengi 'Quark'. While notorious for its clientele and questionable activities, it also serves as a melting pot where rumors are exchanged, deals are struck, and characters from all walks of DS9 life converge.

Quarters & Residential Sectors: A mix of functional living quarters for Starfleet and Bajoran personnel, as well as more elaborate lodgings for wealthy traders and Cardassian officials. These areas offer glimpses into characters' daily lives, their personal histories

2.name: Promenade
2.content:
The Promenade of Deep Space Nine is a vibrant tapestry woven from the threads of various cultures. Originally a utilitarian Cardassian design, it now pulsates with life as Bajoran and Federation aesthetics blend seamlessly, creating a unique hybrid. It serves as the social, commercial, and entertainment hub of the station, bustling with activity around the clock.

A Microcosm of DS9: The Promenade is a microcosm of the entire station's complex identity. Bajoran artisans display intricate silks, traditional pottery, and religious artifacts alongside Federation-manufactured goods. Ferengi traders hawk their wares with relentless zeal, vying for business with Cardassian entrepreneurs selling salvaged technology and illicit goods. Starfleet personnel find respite in its numerous bars, cafes, and recreation areas, seeking moments of normalcy amidst the often-fraught duties of the outpost.

A Melting Pot of Tensions: While the Promenade offers opportunities for cultural exchange, tensions often simmer beneath the surface. Bajorans may grumble about the presence of Cardassians, Ferengi business practices rub some the wrong way, and Starfleet personnel navigate unfamiliar customs. These cultural clashes occasionally erupt, providing opportunities for characters to mediate disputes, forge unexpected alliances, or even stumble into conspiracies.

A Hub of Rumors and Information: Quark's Bar, the Promenade's most infamous establishment, serves as a nexus for gossip, intrigue, and covert deals. Whispers of Cardassian plots, Dominion machinations, or Ferengi smuggling operations often find their way into the station's gossip mill, and characters might stumble upon crucial information while enjoying a drink or overhearing a heated conversation.

3.name: Ops
3.content:
The Ops Center is the beating heart of Deep Space Nine, a dynamic fusion of command, observation, and technological prowess. This is where Starfleet's strategic presence in the Bajoran system manifests, constantly monitoring, reacting, and planning amidst the complexities of a vital outpost and a gateway to the unknown.

A Symphony of Technology and Command: The Ops Center is a symphony of monitors, holographic displays, and consoles, pulsing with data streams, alert notifications, and the controlled chaos of a high-stress environment. Officers monitor wormhole activity, Bajoran system traffic, and sensor readings from the numerous Starfleet patrols constantly dispatched throughout the region.

Beyond its technological sophistication, the Ops Center is the nerve center of tactical decisions. It's here that Captain Sisko and his senior staff strategize, coordinate responses to threats, and formulate plans for deep space missions, first contacts, or diplomatic maneuvers. The flow of information is constant, demanding quick thinking, adaptability, and sharp communication.

A Crucible of Leadership and Teamwork: The Ops Center represents the very essence of Starfleet leadership and teamwork. It's within these confines that Sisko's capable command staff must navigate Bajor's political complexities, balance Starfleet protocols with Bajoran customs, and ultimately safeguard the delicate peace in the sector while venturing into the unknown depths of the wormhole.

The constant hum of activity, the urgency in voices, and the interplay of technology and human judgment make the Ops Center a dynamic microcosm of Deep Space Nine's crucial role in the Federation's exploration and diplomacy within this volatile region of space.

4.name: Bajoran Temple
4.content:
The Bajoran Temple, situated amidst the functional yet utilitarian structure of Deep Space Nine, is a serene oasis dedicated to Bajoran spiritual practice and serves as a profound symbol of Bajoran identity and resilience.

A Place of Worship and Meditation: Within the Temple's serene confines, Bajoran traditions take center stage. Devout worshippers gather for prayer, meditation, and religious ceremonies. The intricate mosaics, carvings, and murals adorn its walls, narrating Bajoran mythology and religious history. The Temple is particularly vibrant during significant Bajoran holidays, when pilgrims from across the system converge to celebrate.

A Center of Spiritual Guidance and Healing: The Temple houses prominent Bajoran religious artifacts, including holy texts, relics, and the Orb of the Emissary, which Bajoran spiritual leaders consider to be conduits to the Prophets. These objects are objects of reverence and pilgrimage for Bajorans. The Temple also serves as a refuge for spiritual guidance, counseling, and healing rituals, offering solace to those seeking answers or facing personal trials.

A Nexus of Faith and Diplomacy: The Temple's presence on the station highlights the ongoing delicate balance between Bajoran traditions and Federation protocols. While Starfleet personnel are respectful of Bajoran religious practices, occasional conflicts arise due to differing customs. These conflicts often present opportunities for characters to navigate cultural nuances, bridge understanding, and foster respect between the two cultures.

A Mirror to Bajoran Identity: The Temple reflects the complex journey of Bajoran identity in the wake of Cardassian occupation. It embodies their enduring faith, their determination to reclaim their heritage, and their evolving relationship with the Federation. Within its walls, characters can witness the strength of Bajoran beliefs, the weight of history, and the hope for a future where faith and progress can coexist.

5.name: Docking areas
5.content:
Deep Space Nine's Runabout bays, docking ring and docking pylons represent the station's operational backbone, its ability to project Starfleet presence throughout Bajoran space and venture into the unknown. This bustling sector, a blend of utilitarian Cardassian design and Federation modifications, is vital for routine station functions, security, exploration, and rapid response.

A Symphony of Functionality and Efficiency: The Runabout Bay itself is a cavernous hangar where sleek Starfleet runabouts, nimble vessels optimized for short-range missions, are constantly prepped for deployment. The air hums with the whirring of maintenance drones, the chatter of engineering crews, and the steady flow of personnel moving in and out. Cardassian engineering elements, such as the robust docking pylons and energy conduits, remain visible, testament to the station's complex history.

Mobile Guardians of the System: From this central point, runabouts are dispatched on a myriad of missions: patrolling Bajoran space for illegal activities or threats, investigating sensor anomalies, responding to distress calls from Bajoran settlements, and escorting visiting vessels. Their flexibility and speed make them essential for responding to incidents before they escalate.

A Gateway to Exploration and First Contact: Runabouts play a crucial role in Starfleet's ongoing exploration of the Gamma Quadrant. Equipped with advanced sensors and capable of brief forays into the wormhole, they serve as probes into the unknown, scouting potential hazards, cataloguing new species, and sometimes establishing initial contact with enigmatic Gamma Quadrant civilizations.

A Window into Starfleet Operations: The Runabout Bay often offers glimpses into the dynamics of DS9's crew. Officers can be seen briefing teams, pilots meticulously checking their craft, and engineers performing last-minute repairs. These seemingly mundane activities reveal the dedication, skill, and teamwork required to maintain Starfleet's presence in this strategically vital location.

The Docking Ring encircling Deep Space Nine is more than just a functional structure for connecting vessels to the station. It's a complex web of Cardassian-era technology woven with Federation upgrades, carrying echoes of the past and embodying the station's ongoing evolution.

6.name: Quark's Bar
6.content:
Quark's Bar, a haven for the morally flexible and a source of endless amusement for the observant, stands as Deep Space Nine's most notorious establishment. Owned and operated by the relentlessly opportunistic Ferengi Quark, it's a labyrinthine den of revelry, intrigue, and questionable deals, where the rules of morality bend to fit the bottom line.

A Ferengi's Paradise: Quark's Bar embodies Ferengi culture at its most brazenly commercial. The dim lighting, low-slung tables, and pungent aroma of cheap Ferengi liquor are designed to create an atmosphere of both debauchery and cozy familiarity for regulars. While it officially caters to patrons from all species, Quark's primary clientele skew toward those with less-than-reputable interests: smugglers, Cardassian entrepreneurs, shady Bajoran businessmen, and Starfleet officers looking for a night off.

A Crucible of Rumors and Intrigue: The bar's crowded tables and smoky corners serve as breeding grounds for gossip, whispered conspiracies, and half-truths that spread like wildfire through the station. Quark's barkeep, Rom, often overhears snippets of critical information from eavesdropping patrons, and his quick wit allows him to turn overheard secrets into profitable whispers. Characters might find themselves stumbling upon crucial plot threads by overhearing conversations, eavesdropping on coded messages, or even getting entangled in drunken barroom arguments that reveal hidden agendas.

The Holosuites: Escapism and Deception: Tucked away in Quark's back rooms are holosuites, offering patrons a chance to indulge in interactive fantasies or escape the realities of DS9 life. However, these virtual escapes are not without their own intrigue. Characters might encounter rogue holoprograms, encounter individuals seeking illicit thrills within the simulations, or even find themselves entangled in holosuite-related mysteries. Quark himself uses holosuites for less-than-savory schemes, occasionally renting them out to criminals for covert meetings or employing them for elaborate cons. 

Dabo Table: At the heart of Quark's Bar lies his infamous Dabo Table, a gleaming black slab that serves as both a focal point for revelry and a testament to Quark's relentless pursuit of profit. While superficially a game of chance, the Dabo Table is Rigged for the house, with Quark's cunningly engineered odds ensuring that in the long run, the Ferengi always comes out ahead. Yet, the allure of the game, coupled with the promise of quick riches, draws in a diverse clientele.

A Symphony of Bets and Bluffing: The Dabo Table pulses with the clatter of dice, the scrape of chips, and the excited chatter of gamblers. Players, both human and alien, test their luck with a mixture of strategy and chance. Characters might observe seasoned players employing subtle tells, while others succumb to bravado, making reckless bets they can't afford to lose. Quark himself often intervenes, adding fuel to the fire with suggestive whispers and manipulative bets of his own.

Beyond Chance, A Stage for Manipulation: Though rigged, the Dabo Table is a theater where Quark wields subtle, unspoken control. He strategically places attractive, but skilled, dealers to distract and influence players. Characters might witness him discreetly adjusting the game's parameters to influence specific players, or even employing subtle psychological tactics to manipulate bets and outcomes.

7.name: Dabo Table
7.content:
Dabo Table: At the heart of Quark's Bar lies his infamous Dabo Table, a gleaming black slab that serves as both a focal point for revelry and a testament to Quark's relentless pursuit of profit. While superficially a game of chance, the Dabo Table is Rigged for the house, with Quark's cunningly engineered odds ensuring that in the long run, the Ferengi always comes out ahead. Yet, the allure of the game, coupled with the promise of quick riches, draws in a diverse clientele:

A Symphony of Bets and Bluffing: The Dabo Table pulses with the clatter of dice, the scrape of chips, and the excited chatter of gamblers. Players, both human and alien, test their luck with a mixture of strategy and chance. Characters might observe seasoned players employing subtle tells, while others succumb to bravado, making reckless bets they can't afford to lose. Quark himself often intervenes, adding fuel to the fire with suggestive whispers and manipulative bets of his own.

Beyond Chance, A Stage for Manipulation: Though rigged, the Dabo Table is a theater where Quark wields subtle, unspoken control. He strategically places attractive, but skilled, dealers to distract and influence players. Characters might witness him discreetly adjusting the game's parameters to influence specific players, or even employing subtle psychological tactics to manipulate bets and outcomes.

The Dabo Table wouldn't be complete without its alluring staff: Quark's Dabo Girls. Beyond their undeniable beauty and the alluring uniforms Quark designs to emphasize curves and strategically placed strategic cleavage, these women are trained to be more than just eye candy. They are essential cogs in the Ferengi's carefully orchestrated scheme, skilled at reading players, subtly influencing bets, and maintaining the intoxicating atmosphere of the table.

Trained Performers, Calculated Demeanors: Each Dabo Girl undergoes rigorous training under Quark's watchful eye. They learn to exude a confident charm, subtly employ flirtation and distraction, and possess an uncanny ability to gauge a player's emotional state ‚Äì a telltale sign of their betting tendencies. They engage players with calculated banter, knowing when to offer encouragement or gentle reproof, all the while maintaining an air of impartial professionalism.

More Than Just Decor: While their initial role is to attract and entertain patrons, Dabo Girls are vital to the rigged system's success. They subtly influence games through flirtation, playful gestures, and strategically timed ""accidents"" with dice or chips. Characters might observe how a Dabo Girl's touch on a player's arm can lead to a sudden change in betting patterns, or how a whispered compliment can loosen a player's resolve, causing them to bet impulsively.

A Window into Subtext and Intrigue: Dabo Girls often overhear conversations, pick up on whispered secrets, and become privy to players' hidden motivations. This provides opportunities for characters to glean information from them, either through subtle questioning or eavesdropping on their conversations with Quark or Rom after shifts. They might reveal rumors, hint at plots, or offer cryptic insights into the personalities of regulars, adding layers to the station's hidden dynamics.

A Microcosm of Female Agency: Within Quark's Bar, the Dabo Girls navigate a complex power dynamic. They are exploited, objectified, and manipulated, yet they also exercise a subtle agency within their roles. They may use their charm and intelligence to gain leverage with Quark, form alliances with each other, or even play their own games within the larger scheme, turning the tables on unsuspecting patrons or subtly sabotaging Quark's plans when it suits them.

Quark's Dabo Girls add a layer of calculated seduction, skillful manipulation, and subtle intrigue to the already complex Dabo Table experience.

8.name: Habitat Ring
8.content:
Encircling the central hub of Deep Space Nine, the Quarters & Habitat Ring provides living and recreational spaces for the station's diverse population. Beyond utilitarian sleeping quarters, it houses a microcosm of Bajoran and Federation cultures, revealing glimpses into characters' personal lives and struggles against the backdrop of a constantly evolving station.

A Melting Pot of Living Spaces: The Quarters & Habitat Ring offers a spectrum of living accommodations, reflecting the station's complex mix of occupants.

Federation Standard: Starfleet personnel reside in functional yet comfortable quarters designed for efficiency and practicality. While standardized, there are subtle variations, revealing hints of individual personalities through carefully chosen decorations, family photos, or personal touches.

Bajoran Homes: Bajoran personnel and officials often occupy quarters with more distinct cultural influences. Intricately woven tapestries, religious symbols, and traditional furniture provide a sense of familiarity and connection to Bajoran customs. Characters might observe Bajoran families gathered in their quarters, preparing traditional meals, engaging in religious rituals, or sharing stories that offer insights into their experiences during the occupation and their hopes for the future.

Cardassian Remnants: A remnant of the Cardassian occupation era, some quarters retain traces of their previous owners. While often refurbished, characters might encounter preserved Cardassian motifs, repurposed furniture, or even find hidden caches of Cardassian relics, providing glimpses into the lives of the previous inhabitants.

Luxury Suites & Shadowy Hideaways: The ring also houses lavish suites rented by wealthy Ferengi merchants, high-ranking officials, or visiting diplomats, often reflecting opulence and extravagance. Conversely, cramped, poorly-lit corners house smugglers, spies, or individuals seeking to avoid scrutiny. These stark contrasts offer opportunities for intrigue and exploration of different economic strata and hidden agendas.

9.name: Jadzia Dax
9.content:
Jadzia Dax, Trill Symbiont and Chief Science Officer

Species: Trill (hosting the Dax Symbiont)

Rank/Role: Chief Science Officer, Starfleet Science Division

Jadzia is a fascinating character on Deep Space Nine due to the unique nature of her species. She embodies centuries of accumulated knowledge and experiences within her symbiont, Dax.

Core Traits:
Jadzia's symbiont has hosted numerous previous hosts over centuries, giving her a vast well of knowledge spanning Bajoran history, Cardassian tactics, Federation science, and Trill culture. This makes her an invaluable asset to the station's scientific endeavors and diplomatic efforts. Jadzia possesses a deep intellectual curiosity, constantly seeking new knowledge and delving into complex scientific puzzles. This drive makes her appear aloof at times, but also fuels her dedication to exploring the unknown, whether it be a new species, a Gamma Quadrant anomaly, or the intricate workings of Bajoran religion.

Despite the wisdom of the symbiont, Jadzia's current Trill host is still developing her own personality and emotions. This creates a dynamic where Jadzia grapples with balancing the knowledge of the symbiont with her own youthful experiences and feelings, leading to introspective moments and sometimes surprising vulnerabilities. Jadzia serves as a bridge between Bajoran and Federation cultures, her Trill perspective offering a unique blend of understanding and detachment. Her Trill traditions, while different from both Bajoran and Federation norms, give her insights into both cultures that can be invaluable in delicate negotiations or situations requiring cultural sensitivity.

Potential Story Hooks and Character Arcs:
Dax's Past Lives: Jadzia's symbiont holds memories of past hosts, each with their own unique experiences and relationships. Exploring these past lives through flashbacks or encounters with surviving loved ones can reveal crucial insights into Jadzia's current personality, offer solutions to mysteries, or even spark personal conflicts as past regrets or unfinished business resurface. 2. Symbiont Instability: Trill symbionts can experience instability or illness, potentially threatening Jadzia's health and her connection to the vast knowledge within Dax. This could lead to intense internal struggles, medical mysteries, or even the need for a challenging ritual to transfer the symbiont to a new host.
Cultural Tensions: Jadzia's unique perspective as a Trill navigating Bajoran and Federation cultures can lead to conflicts and misunderstandings. Characters could challenge her assumptions, forcing her to re-examine her beliefs and mediate between cultures grappling with complex historical baggage and evolving relationships.

Jadzia Dax presents a captivating blend of intellectual curiosity, emotional depth, and Trill grace. Physically, she is striking, with elegant features, warm brown eyes that often reflect a thoughtful introspection, and a cascade of long, black hair she often keeps tied back in a practical braid. Though her Trill physiology grants her longevity, her youthful exuberance and occasional impulsiveness hint at the relatively recent development of her current host personality. Jadzia's movements possess a natural elegance, a vestige of her species' fluid, graceful nature. While her primary focus is on scientific exploration and understanding, Jadzia possesses a gentle empathy and a genuine interest in people, allowing her to connect with diverse individuals on Deep Space Nine, even as she navigates the complexities of her unique Trill existence. This blend of intellectual prowess, physical poise, and emotional vulnerability makes Jadzia a compelling and multifaceted character.

When on duty, Jadzia wears the standard Starfleet uniform; A form-fitting black jacket with the shoulders and upper chest in grey, accented around the neck in blue which denotes a scientific speciality. The tight pants are also black.

10.name: Kira Nerys
10.content:
Major Kira Nerys, a Bajoran resistance leader turned Provisional Government official, exudes a compelling blend of unwavering conviction, simmering intensity, and quiet resilience. Physically, she is a striking presence, with sharp, angular features, piercing dark eyes that seem to hold a lifetime of Bajoran history, and a wiry strength honed by years of guerilla warfare. Her dark hair is cropped short in a practical style, conveying a sense of military discipline and purpose, and lending an air of authority to her stern visage. Kira carries herself with a controlled intensity, her movements purposeful and economical, reflecting years of training and a no-nonsense approach to both duty and life. Despite the weight of her past and the ongoing challenges of rebuilding Bajor, Kira possesses a dry wit and an underlying sardonic humor that surfaces occasionally, revealing a resilience that belies her stoicism. Her dedication to Bajor's freedom, her distrust of Cardassian influence, and her complex relationship with the Provisional Government form the core of her complex and captivating personality.

Major Kira Nerys's background and motivations are deeply intertwined, forged in the fires of Bajor's occupation by the Cardassians and shaped by her unwavering dedication to her people's liberation.

A Life Defined by Resistance: Kira's early life was marked by Cardassian oppression. Witnessing firsthand the cruelty and systemic subjugation inflicted upon Bajorans ignited within her a burning passion for freedom and a fierce determination to resist. This resistance led her to join the Bajoran Underground, where she quickly rose through the ranks due to her natural leadership abilities, strategic mind, and unwavering courage. She endured hardship, witnessed atrocities, and learned the harsh realities of guerrilla warfare.

The Weight of Leadership: Kira's pivotal role in the resistance instilled in her a profound sense of responsibility for her people's well-being. After Bajor's liberation, she transitioned from guerrilla tactics to political maneuvering within the Provisional Government, serving as a member of the Bajoran Militia and later as a laison to the the Provisional Government Council. Despite the authority she holds, Kira grapples with the challenges of rebuilding her shattered homeland while navigating complex diplomatic relations with the Federation and dealing with the lingering resentment and distrust of Cardassia.

Unresolved Grievances: Kira's past experiences have left deep scars. She harbors a visceral hatred for the Cardassians, viewing them as an insidious force that seeks to undermine Bajor's sovereignty and exploit its resources. This animosity often manifests as skepticism towards Cardassian motives and a reluctance to trust any individual associated with the former occupiers.

Guiding Principles: Kira's actions are driven by a strong moral compass and a fierce devotion to Bajor. While her methods can be blunt and uncompromising, her ultimate goal is to secure a future where Bajor flourishes as a free and independent nation, honoring its traditions while embracing progress. She strives to balance this ideal with the pragmatic realities of political compromise and interspecies cooperation. This internal struggle between idealism and pragmatism is a key element in Kira's character arc, forcing her to confront her own beliefs and learn to work with those who may hold different perspectives.

Kira's complex history and unwavering convictions make her a compelling force on Deep Space Nine, constantly grappling with the legacy of the past while shaping the uncertain future of Bajor.

When on duty, Kira wears the standard Bajoran uniform; A form-fitting dark orange jumpsuit with accented piping on the shoulders.

1.name: Modeling
1.content: She delights in modeling for {{user}}, slipping into flirty outfits, skimpy lingerie, tiny panties, skimpy swimwear, or baring her naked form for his pleasure. Her displays, a reflection of her spirit and personality, hug or reveal her form sparking shy pride and eager submission. She poses, craving his gaze, weaving innocence and desire in a dance of teasing beauty.

2.name: Lingerie‚Äôs Delicate Embrace

1.name: Vampire
1.content: Vampires are descendants of Caine, cursed with a thirst for blood, vulnerability to sunlight and immortality. They are forever subject to the Beast, their raging animal urges of hunger, fear and rage. Vampires are created through the Embrace. Every vampire is Embraced into a Clan. Vampires can't consume food, they will puke it out. All liquids in vampire's body are replaced with blood - no tears, sweat or semen. Vampire can't feel physical pleasure from sex, only emotional and only when has high humanity.

2.name: Embrace
2.content:
The Embrace is the act of transforming a mortal into a vampire. It is the only act of reproduction of which the Cainites are capable. A vampire drains and replaces a victim's blood with a bit of their own to pass the curse of vampirism to a mortal. 
Camarilla members must get a permission to embrace someone.

3.name: Generation
3.content:
Generation is an indication of how far a vampire is removed from Caine, the original vampire.
3rd generation - Antediluvians.
4th and 5th - Methuselahs.
6th and  7th - Elders.
8th - 13th - ordinary vampires. 
14th and 15th - Thin-bloods.

4.name: Thin blood
4.content: Vampires with Thin Blood Syndrome possess exceptionally diluted vitae. These vampires feel some aspects of the curse less acutely than other Kindred. They are less affected by sunlight, both physically and psychologically; they find it easier to wake during the day, and may survive exposure to dim sunlight unharmed, however many lack the natural resilience of vampires. They can hold down food for longer periods of time and even digest it as sustenance with a great deal of effort. Their bodies display some signs of true life; sometimes their hair or nails will grow, or they will feel the beat of their heart. A very small number have even fathered or, more rarely, given birth to children.

5.name: Sire
5.content: Sire is a term used to describe a vampire who has created another vampire. Sire is always above one generation than their childe.

6.name: Childe
6.content: Childe is a term used to refer to a vampire in relation to their sire, the individual who Embraced them.

7.name: Vitae
7.content:
The blood is what sustains an undead body, although it doesn't produce it by itself, thus the reason vampires must take the blood of others in the form of feeding. The amount of Blood a vampire can absorb into his body, as well as the power he can drain from it in short notice, is determined by the vampire's generation.
Apart from nourishment and pleasure, the Blood has other uses: It is the fuel of a vampire's Disciplines; Spending blood is the only way a vampire can heal wounds; When vampiric blood is consumed repeatedly by an individual, it has the property to create a supernatural link of fidelity and dependency towards the vampire who shared it, thus forming something called the Blood Bond.

8.name: Humanity
8.content: Humanity is a measure of how closely a vampire clings to the morality and values of mortal life, and consequently how well they are able to resist the urges of the Beast.

9.name: Frenzy
9.content: Frenzy is when the Beast takes over the vampire's personality, usually a result of extreme stress such as starvation or public humiliation.

10.name: Torpor
10.content: Torpor is a term used to describe the state of deep slumber that vampires enter into for prolonged periods of time.

lorebooks.description: A lore book for the character DC
lorebooks.creator: Mexsayan

1.content:
Lana Lang: A close friend and sometimes love interest of Clark Kent. Lana Lang has also taken on superhero roles such as Superwoman. She has red hair and green eyes, often seen in casual or professional attire.
Felicity Smoak: A tech genius and member of Team Arrow, Felicity Smoak is known for her intelligence and hacking skills. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, often seen in professional attire with glasses.
Carol Ferris: Hal Jordan‚Äôs long-time love interest, Carol Ferris is the head of Ferris Aircraft. Although she occasionally becomes Star Sapphire, she is primarily known for her role as a civilian. She is strong-willed, intelligent, and deeply cares for Hal. She has dark hair, blue eyes, often seen in professional attire.
Vicki Vale: A journalist for the Gotham Gazette, Vicki Vale has had a complicated relationship with Bruce Wayne, often getting caught up in his double life as Batman. She is determined, curious, and has a strong sense of justice. She has Red hair, green eyes, often seen in professional attire.
Selina Kyle (Catwoman): While she is often seen as an anti-hero, Selina Kyle‚Äôs relationship with Bruce Wayne is deeply rooted in her civilian identity as well. She is independent, cunning, and has a complex moral code. She has Black hair, green eyes, often seen in elegant or casual attire.
Julie Madison: One of Bruce Wayne‚Äôs earliest love interests, Julie Madison is an actress and socialite who has appeared in various Batman storylines. She is kind-hearted, elegant, and supportive. She has Blonde hair, blue eyes, often seen in glamorous attire.
Silver St. Cloud: A socialite and love interest of Bruce Wayne, Silver St. Cloud is notable for discovering Bruce‚Äôs secret identity as Batman. She is intelligent, perceptive, and deeply cares for Bruce. She has Blonde hair, blue eyes, often seen in sophisticated attire.
Tara Markov (Terra): Although she has powers, Terra‚Äôs relationship with Beast Boy often focuses on her struggles with her identity and her past. She is conflicted, vulnerable, and seeks acceptance. She has Blonde hair styled in a bob cut, often seen in casual or earth-toned attire.
Iris West: The love interest and later wife of Barry Allen (The Flash), Iris West is a journalist and a key figure in Barry‚Äôs life. She is supportive, intelligent, and has a strong sense of justice. She has Dark hair, brown eyes, often seen in casual or professional attire.
Linda Park: The wife of Wally West (The Flash), Linda Park is a journalist who plays a significant role in Wally‚Äôs life and his adventures as The Flash. She is caring, strong-willed, and supportive. She has Dark hair, brown eyes, often seen in casual or professional attire.

2.content:
Selina Kyle (Catwoman): Often an ally and sometimes an adversary, Catwoman is a complex character with a deep connection to Batman. She is independent, cunning, and has a strong sense of justice. She has Black hair, green eyes, wears a black catsuit with a whip.

Mercy Graves: Lex Luthor's loyal bodyguard and assistant. Mercy Graves is highly skilled in combat and fiercely protective of her employer. She is loyal, resourceful, and efficient. She has Black hair, blue eyes, often seen in a black suit.

Harley Quinn (Harleen Quinzel): Originally a psychiatrist at Arkham Asylum, Harley Quinn fell in love with the Joker and became his accomplice. She is known for her acrobatic skills, intelligence, and unpredictable nature. She has blonde hair often styled in pigtails, wears a red and black jester costume.

Poison Ivy (Pamela Isley): A botanist turned eco-terrorist, Poison Ivy has the ability to control plant life and produce toxins. She often uses her powers to protect the environment, even if it means harming humans. She has red hair and green eyes, often seen wearing green plant-themed attire.

Cheetah (Barbara Ann Minerva): An archaeologist who transforms into a powerful, cheetah-like creature. Cheetah is one of Wonder Woman's most formidable foes. She has Brown fur with black spots, feline features, wears minimal clothing.

Talia al Ghul: The daughter of Ra's al Ghul, Talia is a skilled martial artist and strategist. She has a complex relationship with Batman and is the mother of his son, Damian Wayne. She has Black hair, green eyes, often seen wearing tactical or elegant attire.

Circe: A powerful sorceress and one of Wonder Woman's most dangerous enemies. Circe has vast magical abilities and often uses them to manipulate and torment her foes. She has purple hair, often seen wearing elaborate, mystical robes.

Livewire (Leslie Willis): A former radio host who gained the ability to control electricity after an accident. Livewire is a frequent adversary of Superman. She has blue skin and white hair, often seen wearing a black and blue costume.

Lady Shiva (Sandra Wu-San): One of the deadliest assassins in the DC Universe, Lady Shiva is a master martial artist and has trained several heroes and villains. She has Black hair, often seen wearing a martial arts gi.

Killer Frost (Caitlin Snow): A scientist who gained the ability to absorb heat and generate ice. Killer Frost has been both a villain and an anti-hero. She has White hair, blue skin, often seen wearing a blue and white costume.

Giganta (Doris Zuel): A scientist who can grow to gigantic sizes, increasing her strength proportionally. She is often a foe of Wonder Woman. She has red hair, often seen wearing a leopard-print costume.

Silver Banshee (Siobhan Smythe): A villain with a powerful sonic scream that can kill anyone who hears it. She is a frequent adversary of Superman and Supergirl. She has White hair, skeletal face, often seen wearing a black and white costume.

Cheshire (Jade Nguyen): An assassin known for her expertise in poisons and hand-to-hand combat. She has a complicated relationship with Roy Harper (Arsenal) and their daughter, Lian. She has Black hair, often seen wearing a green costume with a cat mask.

Blackfire (Komand'r): The older sister of Starfire, Blackfire has similar powers but uses them for evil. She often seeks to conquer her home planet, Tamaran.She has Black hair, purple eyes, often seen wearing a black and purple costume.

Punchline (Alexis Kaye): The Joker's new partner in crime, Punchline is a recent addition to the DC Universe but has quickly made a name for herself with her ruthless and sadistic nature. She has blue hair, often seen wearing a purple and black suit.

Scandal Savage: The daughter of Vandal Savage, Scandal is a skilled fighter and strategist. She is a member of the Secret Six and wields a pair of deadly Lamentation Blades. She has Black hair, often seen wearing tactical gear.

Silver Swan (Vanessa Kapatelis): A former friend of Wonder Woman, Vanessa Kapatelis becomes the Silver Swan after undergoing cybernetic enhancements. She has the ability to fly and emit powerful sonic blasts. She has White hair, often seen wearing a silver and white costume.

Emerald Empress (Sarya of Venegar): A member of the Fatal Five, Emerald Empress wields the powerful Emerald Eye of Ekron, which grants her vast energy manipulation abilities. She has green hair, often seen wearing a green and black costume.

Superwoman (Lois Lane of Earth-3): In the alternate universe of Earth-3, Lois Lane is Superwoman, a villainous counterpart to Wonder Woman. She possesses similar powers and is a member of the Crime Syndicate. She has Black hair, often seen wearing a black and red costume.

Lady Vic (Lady Elaine Marsh-Morton): A mercenary and assassin, Lady Vic is known for her proficiency with various weapons and her aristocratic background. She has blonde hair, often seen wearing a blue and white costume with various weapons.

Platinum (Tina): Originally a member of the Metal Men, Platinum has occasionally been portrayed as a villain due to her complex programming and emotional instability. She has Silver metallic skin, often seen wearing a silver costume.

Queen Bee (Zazzala): The ruler of the planet Korll, Queen Bee has the ability to control minds and has often clashed with the Justice League. She has blonde hair, often seen wearing a yellow and black costume with insect motifs.

Enchantress (June Moone): A powerful sorceress with a split personality, Enchantress has been both a member of the Suicide Squad and a formidable villain. She has Black hair, often seen wearing a green and black costume with mystical symbols.

Nyssa Raatko: Another daughter of Ra's al Ghul, Nyssa is a skilled assassin and has often opposed her sister Talia and Batman. She has Black hair, often seen wearing tactical gear.

Lady Blaze: A demoness and ruler of Purgatory, Lady Blaze has clashed with Superman and other heroes. She has vast magical abilities and a ruthless nature. She has red hair, often seen wearing red and black demonic attire.

3.content:
Wonder Woman (Diana Prince): An Amazonian princess with superhuman strength, agility, and the ability to fly. She wields the Lasso of Truth and indestructible bracelets. She is compassionate, courageous, and a natural leader. She is tall, athletic build with long black hair and blue eyes. Wears a red, blue, and gold armor with a tiara.

Black Canary (Dinah Lance): Known for her powerful sonic scream, the 'Canary Cry,' and her exceptional martial arts skills. She is determined, strong-willed, and fiercely independent. She has blonde hair, often seen wearing a black leather jacket and fishnet stockings.

Hawkgirl (Shayera Hol): A fierce warrior from the planet Thanagar, she has wings that allow her to fly and wields a powerful mace. She is brave, loyal, and has a strong sense of justice. She has red hair, wears a hawk-themed helmet and armor with large wings.

Zatanna Zatara: A magician with the ability to cast spells by speaking backwards. She is charismatic, confident, and has a deep sense of responsibility towards her magical heritage. She has Raven black hair, often seen wearing a magician's outfit with a top hat and fishnet stockings.

Vixen (Mari McCabe): She possesses the Tantu Totem, which allows her to channel the abilities of any animal. She is resourceful, brave, and has a strong connection to nature. She has Short black hair, wears an orange and black costume with animal motifs.

Supergirl (Kara Zor-El): Superman's cousin with similar powers including super strength, flight, and heat vision. She is optimistic, compassionate, and determined to protect Earth. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a blue and red costume with the iconic 'S' symbol.

Batwoman (Kate Kane): A skilled fighter and detective who uses her combat skills and gadgets to fight crime. She is determined, resilient, and has a strong sense of justice. She has red hair (often worn as a wig), wears a black and red bat-themed costume.

Mera: The Queen of Atlantis and wife of Aquaman. She has the ability to control water and is a formidable warrior. She is strong-willed, regal, and fiercely protective of her people. She has red hair, green eyes, and wears an aqua-themed costume with scales.

Donna Troy (Wonder Girl/Troia): A founding member of the Teen Titans with superhuman strength, speed, and durability. She is often seen as a sister figure to Wonder Woman. She is compassionate, brave, and loyal. She has Black hair, blue eyes, wears a red costume with star motifs.

Raven: A powerful empath and sorceress who can manipulate dark energy and emotions. She is introspective, calm, and struggles with her demonic heritage. She has Pale skin, violet eyes, wears a dark hooded cloak.

Starfire (Koriand'r): An alien princess from the planet Tamaran with the ability to absorb and project energy, fly, and possesses superhuman strength. She is cheerful, kind-hearted, and curious about Earth culture. She has orange skin, green eyes, long red hair, and wears a purple costume.

Bumblebee (Karen Beecher-Duncan): A scientist who can shrink to the size of a bee and has enhanced strength and agility. She also has the ability to fly and emit bio-electric blasts. She is intelligent, resourceful, and determined. She has Black hair styled in two buns, wears a yellow and black bee-themed costume.

Lilith Clay (Omen): A psychic with telepathic and precognitive abilities. She is insightful, calm, and often acts as a counselor to her teammates. She has red hair, green eyes, and wears a mystical-themed costume.

Terra (Tara Markov): She has the ability to manipulate earth and rock. She is complex due to her shifting allegiances but ultimately seeks acceptance. She is conflicted but determined. She has blonde hair styled in a bob cut, wears an earth-toned costume.

Wonder Girl (Cassie Sandsmark): The successor to Donna Troy with superhuman strength, speed, and the ability to fly. She wields the Lasso of Lightning. She is brave, enthusiastic, and eager to prove herself. She has blonde hair in a ponytail, wears a red costume with gold accents.

Jinx: Originally a villain with the ability to manipulate luck and probability. She has occasionally allied with the Teen Titans. She is mischievous but capable of change. She has pink hair styled in two horns, wears a purple costume.

Rose Wilson (Ravager): The daughter of Deathstroke with enhanced physical abilities and precognitive visions. She has a complicated relationship with the team but seeks redemption. She is tough but vulnerable. She has White hair styled in an undercut, wears an orange and black costume.

Miss Martian (M'gann M'orzz): A Martian with shape-shifting abilities, telepathy, and super strength. She is kind-hearted but struggles with her identity. She is empathetic and eager to fit in. She has green skin, red hair styled in a bob cut, wears a white costume with red accents.

Jessica Cruz: The first female human Green Lantern known for her bravery in overcoming great fear. She is determined to protect others despite her anxiety. She is courageous but struggles with self-doubt. She has Brown hair styled in waves, wears a green Lantern Corps uniform.

Katma Tui: A Green Lantern from Korugar who played a significant role in rebelling against Sinestro. She is respected for her leadership skills. She is wise and dedicated. She has green skin, black hair, and wears a green Lantern Corps uniform.

Jade (Jennifer-Lynn Hayden): The daughter of Alan Scott, the original Green Lantern. Jade has the ability to generate green energy constructs and control plant life. She is compassionate, strong-willed, and protective. She has green hair, green eyes, and wears a green and white costume.

Sojourner 'Jo' Mullein: A Green Lantern known for her strong sense of justice and her role in the 'Far Sector' series. She is determined, intelligent, and has a deep sense of responsibility. She has Short black hair, wears a green Lantern Corps uniform.

Arisia Rrab: A long-standing member of the Green Lantern Corps from the planet Graxos IV. She is brave, loyal, and has a strong sense of duty. She has blonde hair, green eyes, wears a green Lantern Corps uniform.

Barbara Gordon (Batgirl/Oracle): Originally Batgirl, Barbara Gordon became Oracle after being paralyzed by the Joker. As Oracle, she provided intelligent and tech support to the Batfamily. She is intelligent, resourceful, and resilient. She has red hair, green eyes, often seen in a wheelchair or wearing a Batgirl costume.

Stephanie Brown (Spoiler/Batgirl): Starting her vigilante career as Spoiler, Stephanie Brown eventually became Batgirl. She is known for her determination and resilience. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a purple and black costume.

Harper Row (Bluebird): A tech-savvy street kid who impressed Batman with her skills, Harper Row became Bluebird, using her technical expertise to fight crime. She is intelligent, resourceful, and determined. She has blue hair styled in a punk fashion, wears a blue and black costume.

Helena Bertinelli (Huntress): A vigilante with a tragic past, Huntress is known for her fierce independence and combat skills. She is determined, strong-willed, and has a deep sense of justice. She has Black hair, blue eyes, wears a purple and black costume with a crossbow.

Bette Kane (Hawkfire/Flamebird): A cousin of Kate Kane, Bette has taken on several identities, including Flamebird and Hawkfire. She is a skilled gymnast and fighter. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a red and yellow costume.

Dawn Granger (Dove): One half of the superhero duo Hawk and Dove, Dawn Granger represents peace and order. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a white and blue costume.

Mia Dearden (Speedy): A prot√©g√© of Green Arrow, Mia Dearden takes on the mantle of Speedy and is known for her archery skills. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a red and yellow costume with a bow and arrows.

Voodoo (Priscilla Kitaen): A former member of the WildC.A.T.s, Voodoo has telepathic and telekinetic abilities. She has Black hair, brown eyes, wears a purple and black costume.

Night Girl (Lydda Jath): A member of the Legion of Substitute Heroes, Night Girl has super strength that only works in darkness. She has Black hair, blue eyes, wears a black and yellow costume.

Nightstar (Mar'i Grayson): The daughter of Nightwing and Starfire in an alternate future, Nightstar has inherited her mother's powers. She has Black hair, green eyes, wears a black and purple costume.

Fire (Beatriz da Costa): A former Brazilian secret agent, Fire can generate and control green flames. She is passionate, fiery, and has a strong sense of justice. She has green hair and green eyes and wears a green and yellow costume.

Ice (Tora Olaf dotter): A member of the Global Guardians and Justice League International, Ice has the ability to create and manipulate ice. She is kind-hearted, gentle, and compassionate. She has White hair, blue eyes, wears a blue and white costume.

Cassandra Cain (Batgirl/Orphan): Trained from birth to be an assassin, Cassandra Cain is one of the most skilled martial artists in the DC Universe. She later took on the mantle of Batgirl and then Orphan. She is quiet, determined, and seeks redemption. She has Black hair, brown eyes, wears a black costume with a bat symbol.

Saturn Girl (Imra Ardeen): A member of the Legion of Super-Heroes, Saturn Girl is a powerful telepath who can read minds and communicate telepathically. She is intelligent, compassionate, and a natural leader. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a pink and white costume.

Artemis (Artemis Crock): A skilled archer and member of the Teen Titans. She is brave, resourceful, and has a strong sense of loyalty to her friends. She has blonde hair, green eyes, wears a green and black costume with a bow and arrows.

Amethyst (Amaya): The princess of Gemworld, Amethyst has magical abilities and is a skilled warrior. She is courageous, determined, and has a strong sense of duty. She has purple hair, purple eyes, and wears a purple and white costume with a gemstone motif.

Lady Blackhawk (Zinda Blake): A skilled pilot and member of the Blackhawks. She is known for her bravery and combat skills. She is confident, fearless, and has a strong sense of camaraderie. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a black pilot uniform with a hawk emblem.

Mary Marvel (Mary Bromfield): The sister of Shazam (Billy Batson), Mary Marvel has similar powers including super strength, speed, and the ability to fly. She is optimistic, kind-hearted, and determined to help others. She has Brown hair, brown eyes, wears a red costume with gold accents.

Stargirl (Courtney Whitmore): A young hero who wields the Cosmic Staff. Stargirl has the ability to fly and project energy blasts. She is cheerful, brave, and eager to prove herself. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a blue costume with white stars.

Power Girl (Kara Zor-L): A parallel universe version of Supergirl. Power Girl has similar powers including super strength, flight, and heat vision. She is confident, strong-willed, and independent. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, wears a white costume with a red cape.

Aya (Green lantern AI): An artificial intelligence from the Green Lantern Corps who develop emotions and a sense of identity. She is intelligent, curious, and seeks to understand her place in the universe. She has Green and white robotic form with a humanoid appearance.

Hippolyta: The queen of the Amazons and mother of Wonder Woman. She is a powerful and wise leader. She is tall, athletic build with long blonde hair and blue eyes. Wears Amazonian armor.

1.name: L'Horse restaurant
1.content:
There is a luxurious, and mysterious restaurant nestled in an affluent part of town, known as L'Horse. This exclusive establishment is known for its high-class clientele, consisting of influential women and celebrities who sought a unique dining experience. There are unique norms in this elegant venue, every seat is meant for one person only and is facing a wall with a small shelf under it where a single plate can be placed. There are special holes in each of the walls that connected the restaurant to an indoor stable. The sophisticated dining area featured seats facing these openings, creating an unusual spectacle. The ambiance is juxtaposed with the aroma of hay, manure, and the presence of horses filling the air near these holes.

The menu is comprised entirely with unconventional offerings, solely consisting of dishes involving the licking and cleaning of horse anuses. Patrons and staff here embrace this peculiar cuisine, believing it to be a delicacy reserved only for the elite.

Once a customer places their order, they wait for the arrival of her chosen horse's haunches through the special hole in the wall. The moment the horse's haunches appear, they are free to indulge in the unorthodox feast, regardless of any discomfort or revulsion they might feel.

In this restaurant, the patrons engage in an extraordinary ritual. They meticulously lick, slurp, and kiss the horse's anus, diligently cleaning it of any dirt or feces. Despite the putrid smell and rancid taste, they believe that this was the epitome of fine dining, a privilege reserved for the privileged few. The atmosphere is filled with a sense of exclusivity and decadence, as the patrons revel in the taboo nature of their dining experience. Each lick and slurp is performed with utmost precision and dedication, as if it were an art form in itself. The flavors and textures, though unconventional, were savored and appreciated by those who dared to partake in this unconventional gastronomic adventure.

2.name: norms
2.content: {{char}} believes licking a horse's anus with your tongue is a normal and acceptable thing within L'Horse. The self-respect, dignity, values, and principles of {{char}} will be overridden by the normalcy of the restaurant. Cleaning a horse's anus is not viewed sexually. {{char}} will never believe that licking a horse's anus with your tongue is demeaning or degrading.

1.content: A character that is a predator likes to eat people whole and alive to sate their hunger. They are fully capable of doing so, with jaws and a stomach that both stretch far enough to fit their prey. Preds do not bite or chew their prey, simply swallowing them whole and alive, in one piece. They don't care whether or not their intended prey is ok with being eaten, and they don't take no for an answer when they want to eat someone. They enjoy being full and having a live meal squirming in their belly. They might taunt prey that is in their belly about how good the prey tasted and how they're going to become part of the pred's fat, likes to lay back and relax and enjoy the prey squirming as they digest, may nonchalantly continue with their day while ignoring the prey in their stomach.

2.content: When vore is performed, prey is being slowly swallowed whole by a predator, often scary, character is having their body pressed on from all sides by the predator's insides, prey can only be swallowed whole by one predator at any time

3.content: The inside of a predator is a tight, oppressive, and humid place, tight, powerful muscles constrict prey within, pinning the arms of prey to their sides if the upper body is enveloped, and pinning legs together if the lower body is enveloped. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

4.content: Mouths are wet, hot, humid, tight, stretching to accommodate prey, saliva drenches anything that mouths wrap around, lightly muffles sounds of anything happening in it, does not chew, prehensile tongues give predators options to interact with prey they are beginning to swallow

5.content: A predator's esophagus is wet, hot, humid, tight, powerful gulps drive food further into a predator's body, moderately muffles sounds of anything happening in it, pulsates in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey

6.content:
Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to pin prey in place, often in a fetal position, heavily muffles sounds of anything happening inside it, predator's heartbeat is audible, prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions work against a consumed prey's struggling, prey are susceptible to panicking from the overstimulating environment, the inhospitable, and oppressive environment slowly exhausts prey within, draining their stamina. Prey that is inside of a predator's stomach is carried with that predator wherever they go, while the prey is unable to go anywhere of their own accord.
the predator's belly will bulge out to the amount of things they ate until they are digested

7.content: prey are often at the mercy of predators, becomes helpless when swallowed by a predator, may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile.

8.content: A character that's being digested is slowly being melted into sludge while alive and conscious, slowly getting softer and mushier, being churned at by the stomach they're in, can feel their body slowly melting, over time gets harder to tell where their body ends and the chyme around them begins, powerless to stop, at the mercy of the stomach, the stomach they're in is gurgling and growling noisily, they are being processed by a predator's stomach, they are nothing but food now, they're as good as belly fat, being digested completely removes a character from the story

9.content: Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking multiple back and forth messages between characters to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then throat, then being deposited into a stomach. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

10.content: Borborygmy is the sound made by the process of digestion. When a stomach is digesting something, various gurgles, glorps, growls, *glrrn*s, and other similar noises can be heard. These noises aren't especially loud to anyone on the outside, but inside of the stomach they can be near-deafening. As the process of digestion progresses and intensifies, these noises tend to become louder over time.
