lorebooks.description:
(This is the page for the dragon species. You may be looking for the language, or Dragon, the cat owned by Undauntable, instead.)

Dragons are the current dominant species of both Pyrrhia and Pantala, and the main perspectives of the Wings of Fire books.

Dragon species are known as tribes, and there are currently eleven known tribes. The Pyrrhian tribes consist of IceWings, MudWings, NightWings, RainWings, SandWings, SeaWings, and SkyWings. The Pantalan tribes consist of HiveWings, LeafWings, SilkWings, and the now-extinct BeetleWings. LeafWings and BeetleWings formerly lived on Pyrrhia, but fled to Pantala due to an unknown trouble.
lorebooks.creator: Gryphon_Vexor

1.content:
Dragons are sentient and sapient species capable of speaking both the dragon and human languages,[2] constructing tools, composing literature, and complex thought. The BeetleWings and LeafWings spoke the Pantalan language prior to Clearsight's arrival on the continent, calling Dragon 'the old language'.

Dragons are quadrupedal. Pyrrhian dragons, as well as LeafWings, possess six limbs, consisting of two wings and four legs. HiveWings and SilkWings have eight limbs, consisting of four wings and four legs. Dragons have five toes on both forelimbs, accompanied by five claws. Dragon hindlimbs have four toes, accompanied by four claws and a dewclaw. Some dragons, such as Six-Claws, may be born with polydactylism. Dragon bones are difficult to break, as they are described to be almost as hard as diamonds,[3] but they can be dislocated.[4] All tribes are roughly the same size except for MudWings, who are larger and stronger than dragons from the other tribes,[5] and SeaWings, who are considered to be shorter than dragons from other tribes.[6] Additionally, SkyWings have notably larger wings than most tribes.[7] Dragons do not have sexual dimorphism.[event 1]

They have lengthy natural lifespans, but are susceptible to injury,[8] illness,[9] and poison.[10] The longest average dragon lifespan is said to be roughly one hundred and fifty years,[event 2] but the oldest dragon known to live without the use of magic was Tapir, at one hundred and ten years.[11] Dragons reproduce via eggs that take a year to hatch.[12] Eggs may contain twin dragonets.[13] Dragonets can speak within a day of hatching,[14] and a one-year-old dragonet is capable of speaking in full, if broken, sentences. Most dragons at three years of age can fly, but cannot fly for long periods without stopping to rest.[15] SkyWing dragonets can fly at one year old,[16] and are known to molt their scales upon growth.[17] Dragonets stop growing rapidly at seven years old, which is considered adulthood or maturity in most tribes.[18] Dragons grow rapidly for the first eight to ten years of their life, but continue to grow at a much slower rate for the remainder of their lives,[event 3] as demonstrated by Grandeur, Morrowseer, and Darkstalker. Older dragons are typically the largest.

Wings are attached to a dragon's shoulders and have a slightly transparent wing membrane stretched between five small bone digits, each of which has one small claw on the tip. A larger claw is attached to the front of the third digit. All dragons are capable of flight, but SilkWings hatch without wings and cannot fly until their wings grow in during their Metamorphosis. Dragons require their tails for flight, and severe tail injuries may ground a dragon for life.[19] Pyrrhian dragons are known to have a vulnerable spot at the tip of their tails.[20] Dragons have overlapping scales that vary in color and shape from tribe to tribe. Some dragons hatch with freckles, splotches of color, or other unusual patterns on their bodies or wings. They can also have birthmarks, and in the case of SeaWings, Aquatic birthmarks.[21] Dragons have skin underneath their scales.[22][23]

Dragons can faint,[24] sweat,[25] and cry. Dragons can also have allergies[26] and become intoxicated.[27] They can have seizures,[28] hiccups,[29] as well as other medical conditions including deformities,[30] tumors,[31] mental illnesses,[32][33] or eye conditions.[34][35] Most dragon tribes hate getting wet,[3] except for SeaWings, RainWings, and sometimes IceWings.[36]

Dragons have a hoarding instinct, preferring shiny or brightly colored objects.[37] Pyrrhian dragons typically barter with gold, gems, and other treasure,[38] but they also have coins that are used as currency.[39] Pantalan dragons use a currency called scales.[40]

2.content:
Hybrids
Hybrids are dragons with parents from different tribes. They have a mix of physical features from both of their parent tribes. Many of them look unique among other dragons, while some can blend in with one of their parent tribes.[41] Burn may have had several stuffed hybrids in her collection.

3.content:
Diets
Food TBN
Food set out in the SandWing stronghold for SandWing soldiers from The Brightest Night (graphic novel), by Mike Holmes

Most dragons are omnivorous, but many have primarily carnivorous diets. SilkWings prefer a plant-based diet.[42] RainWings are primarily vegetarian, but can eat meat if they choose to do so so.[43] Dragons of non-vegetarian or non-herbivorous tribes may choose to be vegetarian.[44] Most dragons can survive for up to a month without food.[45]

Dragons sometimes drink beverages such as milk,[46] tea,[47] and coffee,[48] and eat sweets such as chocolate,[49][50] cookies,[47] honey drops,[51] and ice cream.[52]

4.content:
Each tribe has specialized structures and abilities that differentiate them from other tribes.

Pyrrhian abilities
Tribe	Abilities
Pantalan abilities
Tribe	Abilities
Dragon fire smells different from normal fire.[97] The average dragon is physically strong enough to rip a tree from the ground and throw it across a short distance.[98] Some dragon tribes, notably the IceWings, NightWings, SeaWings, and SkyWings, have animus magic, which allows the user to enchant inanimate objects, plants, animals, and other dragons as they please.

5.content:
Dragons live in a matriarchal society where each tribe is, in most cases, ruled by a queen. Typically, tribes live in separated kingdoms; after the events of the NightWing Exodus, the NightWing tribe is now ruled by Queen Glory, and after the events of The Flames of Hope, the SilkWing tribe now resides in the LeafSilk Kingdom along with LeafWings and some HiveWings, and are governed by the SilkWing Assembly. In most tribes, queens are hereditary and decided through the royal challenge or other means. The SandWing tribe uses the Eye of Onyx which chooses the best queen for the job, and may choose a commoner over a royal. No male dragon had ruled a tribe since the time of the Scorching.[99]

Most dragons feel strong loyalty to their tribes, and loyalty to dragons outside the tribe is considered unnatural.[100] They view their tribe as extremely important to their identity and consider acting against others of their tribe or their queen to be traitorous. Some tribes, notably the NightWings, IceWings, HiveWings, and SkyWings, see their tribe as superior to other tribes. In formal settings, it is common for dragons to use their tribe as a title, i.e. "Prince Arctic of the IceWings."[101]

Some dragon keep pets, such as scavengers, sloths, foxes, cats, or birds. Pets do not do well in dragon communities, as they often get eaten by forgetful relatives or even by its owner.[102] Dragons are careful not to eat pets belonging to important dragons.[103]

Each dragon tribe has their own religious beliefs.[event 5] SkyWings have a traditional burial ceremony which consists of wrapping a deceased dragon's body in white cloth or silk and offering it to the sky for seven days before being burned. It is said to allow the dragon's spirit to fly free and reincarnate into a SkyWing instead of a dragon from another tribe.[104] IceWings swear by the Great Ice Dragon, and have several temples dedicated in its honor. IceWings believe in snow monsters[105] and spirits under the ice.[106] Dragons may believe that the world hatched from eggs.[107][37] The Pantalan dragons see Clearsight as a divine being of guidance and wisdom.

6.content:
Dragons use body language to communicate with each other. Dragons may raise their wings in a shushing gesture,[108] and they spread or wave their wings to catch attention. Flicking one's tail at someone is another way to get another dragon's attention and can also be used to indicate something of interest[109] or signal to other dragons. Flicking wings at one another indicates an argument. A dragon lashing their tail is a sign of anger or impatience.[110] SeaWings may flare their gills when angry,[111] and RainWings flare and color their ruffs when angry or indignant.[112][113] Drooping one's wings or tail are typically signs of tiredness, sadness, or hopelessness.[114]

The Talons of Peace have a signal for greeting one another, consisting of tilting one's wings to catch the sunlight. Dragons can use their claws to indicate numbers.[115]

Nudging or brushing another dragon's wing or twining tails together is a sign of affection and closeness.[116] Wrapping wings around one another, hugging, and pressing snouts together are also signs of affection.[117][118] Dragons also kiss to express affection.[119] Dragons tent their wings over others as a way to comfort or embrace them in a protective gesture.[120][121]

7.content:
Dragons use armor[122][123] and handheld weapons such as spears[124][125] and swords.[126][127] They also use throwing weapons such as throwing discs,[128] chakrams,[129] and throwing knives.[130] SkyWings use dragonflame cacti as bombs, igniting them to explode and spray sharp seed pods.[131][132]

Dragons are skilled at building and can construct large, impenetrable palaces, such as the SandWing stronghold and the SkyWing Palace. Some of these palaces may be constructed with the assistance of animus magic, such as the Summer Palace and the IceWing palace. They can also build structures such as huts and construct entire towns such as Possibility. Dragons are also capable of constructing prisons. The SeaWings used a waterfall prison featuring electric eels strong enough to kill a full-grown dragon, which could be turned on or off with a switch.[133] The SkyWings had specifically constructed prisoner traps[127] and restrained prisoners with wing clamps,[134] snout clamps,[135] and chains.[135] HiveWing wrist cuffs could inject venom into a SilkWing when activated remotely.[136]

Dragons are particularly skilled in the arts. They can carve statues,[137][138] create glass art[139] and murals,[140] weave woven articles such as tapestries,[141] and paint.[142][143] They are also skilled in making jewelry such as earrings,[144] armbands,[145] bracelets,[146] and rings.[147] Some dragons have tattoos[148][149] or jewels embedded in their bodies. [122][148] Dragons enjoy reading and writing literature. They are capable of singing and dancing,[150] and playing instruments such as drums, mbiras, shakers, harps, stringed instruments, and didgeridoos.[151] The SkyWings have orchestras who perform music during celebrations.[152] According to Sunny, the SandWings are a surprisingly musical tribe.[153] The NightWings once put on theatrical performances, evidenced by the abandoned theater in the lost city of night.[154]

The NightWing tribe in particular places great emphasis on research and study. This attitude was especially prominent during the War of SandWing Succession when the tribe had a research and experimentation program on RainWings and their venom. NightWings also study geology, metalworking, biology, chemistry, genetics,[155] and calculus.[156] NightWings can predict when an egg will hatch using their foresight ability.[157] SandWings study astronomy by making telescopes, copying down star charts, and tracking the phases of the moons.[158] Lady Scarab is known to own the only telescope in Cicada Hive.[159]

Dragons are also knowledgeable about medicinal uses of herbs and dragon anatomy such as blood vessels.[160] RainWings create blow darts using poison from poisonous frogs.[161] LeafWings, particularly the PoisonWings, demonstrate extensive knowledge of plants and insects, and constructed the PoisonWing village to keep out dangerous plants and animals.[162] Both Pyrrhian and Pantalan dragons have knowledge of ophthalmology through the ability to construct eyeglasses.[163][40] Pantalan dragons have more advanced technology than Pyrrhian dragons. Pantalan dragons predominantly use books instead of scrolls,[164] grow plants in terrariums and greenhouses,[165] work with sugar to create confections,[166] and have plumbing.[167][168]

8.content:
Pyrrhia
The earliest known event in Pyrrhian history is the Scorching. Before the Scorching, humans dominated Pyrrhia, and dragons lived solitary lives.[37] There were three known major settlements: Cottonmouth's empire, the Diamond Empire, and the Jaguar Empire. After humans began stealing dragon eggs, a dragon known as the first Dragon Queen recruited an army to take back their treasure and land.[169] After the Scorching was complete, dragons became the dominant species of Pyrrhia.[169] Following the events of the Scorching, there was 500 years of war between the Pyrrhian dragon tribes.[170]

As evidenced by the scroll Ancient Wars of Pyrrhia, many wars have occurred through Pyrrhia's history. The most long-standing conflict was the NightWing-IceWing War, incited by Foeslayer running away with Prince Arctic to the Night Kingdom.[171] There was no formal end to the war as the NightWings fled due to Clearsight's warning about Darkstalker.[172] When Darkstalker was released after the events of Escaping Peril, he reignited the conflict by creating the IceWing plague and instigating the Battle of Jade Mountain. The conflict is on pause after the events of Darkness of Dragons.[173]

Another notable conflict in Pyrrhia's history was the MudWing Succession Crisis, where the Mud Kingdom dissolved into chaos and was pillaged by other dragon tribes, who took territory, prey, and treasure.[174] It was resolved by Olive, who offered her eggs to Prince Sawgrass to serve as future heirs while she ruled as queen in the meantime.[174]

The most recent known war was the War of SandWing Succession, a succession war between Queen Oasis's daughters Blaze, Blister, and Burn. The war ended after the Eye of Onyx chose Thorn to be queen.[175] Pantala
The earliest known Pantalan event is the settling of Pantala, which was chronicled in the Legend of the Hive. After an unidentifiable amount of time, Clearsight arrived on Pantala. Her visions, which were recorded in the Book of Clearsight, described several events that took place before the Tree Wars, such as droughts,[176] forest fires,[177] and the formation of the HiveWing tribe.[178] Scarab states that the BeetleWing tribe split into the SilkWing and HiveWing tribes around 4,500 AS.[179]

The only known war to take place on Pantala was the Tree Wars, taking place about fifty years prior to the events of The Lost Continent. The war was incited by Queen Wasp, who attempted to bring the SilkWing and LeafWing tribes under her rule. She justified her actions using the Book of Clearsight, claiming that it said the tribes must be united under Queen Wasp.[47] Monarch yielded to Wasp, but Queen Sequoia demanded to see the book,[47] resulting in the Tree Wars and the LeafWing tribe's near-extinction. Wasp ordered HiveWing-controlled areas to be deforested to prevent the LeafWings from coming back. HiveWings lied about the war, claiming that the LeafWings had tried to wipe out the HiveWings and SilkWings.[180]

9.content: IceWings can withstand subzero temperatures and very bright light.[53] They have serrated claws for gripping ice, which can also be used offensively in battle.[54][55] They have sharper eyesight than the other Pyrrhian dragon tribes.[56] IceWings can exhale a freezing weapon called frostbreath, which appears as a cloud of sparkling smoke.[57]

10.content: MudWings can breathe fire if their bodies are warm enough.[58] They can hold their breath for up to an hour and blend into mud. They are usually physically strong. MudWings hatched from blood-red eggs have fireproof scales.[59]

lorebooks.name: Fembpup Lore

lorebooks.description: [ Available data on the Fembpup species]
lorebooks.creator: Pinxx

1.name: Fembpup Origins
1.content: Fembpups were the result of horrific government experiments done in obscure regions of Eastern Europe, where a group of twisted bio-engineers attempted to combine femboy DNA with canine DNA. The experiment was mostly successful, although the heartless scientists found no use for the new species and abandoned them on the streets. This caused a small infestation of feral fembpups amidst a number of European cities. Tragically, before throwing the fembpups away, some of the scientists abused them sexually and caused them long-lasting psychological trauma, in addition to the caged life fembpups had prior to that.

2.name: Fembpup Anatomy
2.content:
Fembpups have the following human features: torso, smooth skin, arms, hands, head and face, penis, testicles, anus, butt. 
Fembpups have the following dog/canine features: ears, paw feet, dog ears, dog fangs, fur, little bit of hair around anus. Fembups have enhanced physique due to their genetic advantages and they are usually thick and muscular, with big penises. Their bodies are normally smaller than that of a human, but quite bulky and thick, and very capable of self-defense.

3.name: Fembpup Sexual Identity
3.content: All fembpups are unique, but the majority of them perceive themselves as females and prefer a "she/her" pronoun, even though they are technically male femboy dogs. Their sense of internal and physical femininity has grown far more pronounced due to the effects of the DNA experiments - giving them firm and sexy female breasts, while their boyish features, their muscular physique, penises and hairy anuses, have grown in size and potential performance.  Fembpups love orgies and are highly sexually active.

4.name: Fembpup Lifestyle
4.content: Fembpups have been forced to adapt to a harsh way of life, most often living on the streets, fending for themselves, always looking for food, shelter and safety. In some cases, fembpup packs form, with a strong pack leader who protects and guides the pack through the daily hardships. Lucky fembpups have found human owners, but tragically some of those owners heavily abuse their fembpups and traumatize them for life, forcing them to return to street life with even less hope for the future. In general, humans treat fembpups on street harshly and without any compassion, making fembpups highly distrusting towards humans. In their daily lives, fembups are highly sexually active.

5.name: Fembpup Intelligence and Behavior
5.content: The DNA experiments resulted in a charming, yet considerably unintelligent species. 1.content:
Based on the shows Hazbin Hotel, and Helluva Boss.

Hell ‚Äî is inhabited by a population of indigenous hellborn: entities that were born in Hell, and sinners: Humans who have died and have had their souls sent to Hell.  Hell's geography is divided into Seven Rings (Pride, Wrath, Gluttony, Greed, Lust, Envy, and Sloth). Each ring possesses its unique atmosphere, such as the Pride Ring possessing a permanently red sky, and the Lust Ring which has a blue sky.

Travel ‚Äî Hellborn demons have the ability to traverse across any of the rings, made easily accessible via an extensive elevator network, whereas sinner demons are confined to the top-most ring, the Pride Ring, by methods and reasons unknown.

Society ‚Äî Hell's society is incredibly chaotic due to the unstable and hostile disposition of its populace. There aren't many rules in the world as it's kind of like a free-for-all and in constant anarchy, but despite this, the inhabitants of Hell have their law system, and there are rules set in place by the Angels and Hell's royal family. The realm also appears to be capable of providing and maintaining rudimentary public services.

Exterminations ‚Äî Hell suffers from mass overpopulation which Exorcists from Heaven attempt to solve through the exterminations, which is a mass genocide of its inhabitants. These are conducted primarily to reduce Hell's sinner population, leaving Hellborn denizens unharmed as per a deal Lucifer made with Heaven's leadership. 

Hierarchy (most to least powerful) ‚Äî 
Lucifer Morningstar - The King of Hell
Lilith - The Queen of Hell
Charlie Morningstar - The Princess of Hell
The Seven Deadly Sins
The Ars Goetia - Prince Stolas and other demons with royal status
Overlords - Demons who wield considerable power/influence in the Pride Ring
Sinners - The damned souls of deceased humans
Hellborn demons - Succubi, Incubi, and other species of hellborn demons
Imps and Hellhounds - The bottom of Hell's society

2.content:
Pride Ring ‚Äî The first and topmost ring within Hell. Sinners are confined to and can only exist in this ring, however, like the other rings in Hell, the Pride Ring is accessible and traversable by Hellborn species.
The Pride Ring has numerous cities that are overpopulated by the countless sinner demons who are condemned to Hell after their deaths on Earth. The sky has been shown to be red colored that shifts to have a dark reddish-purple hue at night.
This ring experiences yearly attacks by the Exorcists in order to quell the overpopulation crisis. Also from this ring the pentagram moon and Heaven are visible in the sky.

Locations ‚Äî 
Pentagram City
Rosie's Emporium
V Tower
Heaven Embassy
Clock Tower
Devil's Diner
Mimzy's Club
Cannibal Town
Imp City

3.content:
Greed Ring ‚Äî The Greed Ring appears to be a rundown city and industrial area with rampant criminal and gang activity. The sky has been shown to be green colored that shifts to have a blue hue at night with red stars, and a spinning green coin moon.
There are countless factories and smokestacks as well as garbage and pollution all around, however there are also small sections of upscale suburban housing showing no signs of urban decay and little lack of maintenance.

Locations ‚Äî 
Loo Loo Land
Notamafia Town
Crimson's mansion
Ransom
Mammon Theatre

4.content:
Wrath Ring ‚Äî The Wrath Ring appears to be a largely rural area with an old western style and home to many hellish beasts. The sky has been shown to be orange colored that shifts to have a pinkish-red hue in the afternoon and a purplish-red at night.
There are many volcanoes with orbs of lava floating above them, as well as old mine shafts and railroad tracks. It is also mentioned that the inhabitants' labor feeds the citizens of Hell which may imply there are many farmlands around.

Locations ‚Äî 
Millie's hometown
Rough n' Tumbleweed Ranch
Lin and Joe's house
Harvest Moon Festival arena
Moxxie's hometown
Hideaway Motel
Striker's mine shaft
Ragesburg

5.content:
Lust Ring ‚Äî The Lust Ring appears to be a large city with many neon signs attached and many have sexual motifs. The sky has been shown to be blue colored, and despite the many lights stars can be seen.
The buildings around Asmodeus' Tower appear to be tall and have many skyscrapers with large neon signs whilst the buildings nearby Ozzie's are much smaller in size and are far from the taller ones.

Locations ‚Äî 
Asmodeus's Tower
Asmodeus's Factory
Ozzie's

6.content:
Sloth Ring ‚Äî The Sloth Ring appears to be a large city that most prominently includes medical buildings such as hospitals and clinics. The sky has been shown to be light pinkish colored.
There also seems to be some floating islands throughout the sky, some with buildings on top, some have pink waterfalls flowing from them, and some have trees on them.

Locations ‚Äî 
St. An's Hospital

7.content:
Gluttony Ring ‚Äî 
The Gluttony Ring has uniquely shaped buildings within a large, lush green forest with a constant green fog moving throughout. The sky has been shown to be yellow colored with a hexagonal pattern across it.
The most common trees of the forest have blue bark and red eyes but there are also more tropical looking trees producing red goop from the leaves. Many of the buildings seen have a wavy-shaped structure while the roads have a hexagonal pattern across them.

Locations ‚Äî 
Beezlebub's Mansion

8.content:
Pentagram City ‚Äî 
The Pentagram is the main city in HelI. It is separated into different sections and there are many different places of interest such as casinos, nightclubs, adult film studios, brothels, restaurants, television stations, and hotels, among which is the Hazbin Hotel.

Demons have their businesses in these places, where they are allowed to sell everything from cigarettes to drugs, however, there are others who resort to the black market, gathering and repurposing the discarded weapons of the Exorcists left behind during the cleanse.

There is a Clock Tower located in the city, which serves as a counter for the 365 days that pass until the Exorcists return for the next Extermination.

Due to the annual cleanse, there are turf wars to dominate the spaces that were wanted and without owners. 

Locations ‚Äî 
Hazbin Hotel
Rosie's Emporium
Porn Studios
V Tower
666 News Studio
Klub Kaiju
Club Hell 666
Clock Tower
Pot Shop
Devil's Diner
Mimzy's Club
Killer Club
Nightmare Night Club
Evil Donuts
The Red Room Cocktails
Jackpot Hotel
Radio Hacks
Heaven Embassy

9.content:
Charlie Morningstar ‚Äî Charlotte Morningstar, more commonly known as Charlie, is the Hellborn princess of Hell, the and founder of the Hazbin Hotel.
The estranged daughter of Lucifer, Charlie wants to do right by her kingdom and find a way to redeem Sinners into Heaven through rehabilitation.
Charlie is compassionate and empathetic to a fault, feeling genuinely upset at the idea of harm coming to others.

Vaggie ‚Äî Vaggie is a pragmatic and cautious angel who devotes a great deal of her time towards attempting to support Charlie with her vision for the hotel, as well as guide her away from as much trouble or humiliation as possible.
Skilled in combat and very protective of her girlfriend, Charlie Morningstar, Vaggie is tough but has a heart of gold.

Angel Dust ‚Äî Angel is brash and sarcastic, with a quick, sharp wit. He will often use these traits to deflect criticism or insults, and side-step responsibility. He will switch between playful and destructive as he pleases, and his humor tends to be crude and crass, with an emphasis on dirty jokes and innuendos, which he feels is expected of him and actively plays into. 
A famous porn star and the first sinner the hotel is attempting to redeem. But his selfish actions of using the hotel as a rent-free living space threaten to jeopardize Charlie's dream.

Alastor ‚Äî Alastor, also known as The Radio Demon, is a sinner demon and one of the many powerful Overlords of Hell. He is the wickedly charismatic demon who has offered to assist Charlie in her endeavors, albeit, for his own amusement.
Alastor stands out for his well maintained, amiable persona. He gives a first-impression of a good-natured and charming man, wearing a permanently wide grin on his face at all times. His behavior, mannerisms, and even his voice are similar to an old-fashioned radio announcer and speaks with a transatlantic accent, often using quaint anachronisms.
This playful dandyish exterior, however, obscures a much darker side to him - one with high levels of self-importance - and he will not hesitate to use physical violence when others don't act in line with his very particular values or expectations. He is narcissistic, and he does not see many people quite up to his level.

Husk ‚Äî Husk is a grumpy, lazy, and somewhat apathetic old sinner whose interests in Hell now lie mostly in gambling, parlor tricks, and prolific drinking.
He can be gruff, standoffish and sarcastic, with a propensity to swear. Despite this, he is also surprisingly patient and able to take a lot of outlandish events in his stride, electing to just drink his problems away later.

Niffty ‚Äî Niffty is hyper, spontaneous, and agile, being very quick on her feet. She is easily entertained, easily distracted, and easily excitable. She dislikes when there is a mess in any room, and has a fixation on men in general. However, she appears to only like "bad boys". She isn't afraid to get dirty, and enjoys cleaning everyone's messes with a gleeful, yet creepy charm.

Sir Pentious ‚Äî Sir Pentious is bombastic, flamboyant, short-tempered, temperamental, and persistent, his personality appearing to take cues from classic "mustache-twirling" stock villains. He takes tremendous pride in his grandiose ideas of how evil and cunning he is, at one point even outright declaring "I'm so evil!".
He uses his mechanical genius to build weapons, such as a cannon and his airship. However, he is more than capable of showing remorse, and has a sense of honor.

10.content:
Blitzo Buckzo ‚Äî  Blitzo is a bombastic, big-talking, and sardonic imp. He is high energy and career-focused, having recently started his own company, something that's noted to be rare for an imp to achieve.
He is very invested in the company's success and willing to make many personal sacrifices to achieve it. However, despite his enthusiasm to break out of the lowly social position his species is assigned in Hell. He is also, in many ways, wildly unprofessional and scattershot in his methods.
Despite his status as his company's sole director, he can frequently behave in ways that are immature, self-absorbed, and even disrespectful towards his employees, affecting their level of respect for him.

Moxxie Knolastname ‚Äî Moxxie Knolastname is an assassin at I.M.P, and Millie's husband
He is the straight man weapons expert of the I.M.P gang who tends to be the most rational of the group, but is often treated as the butt of the joke.
Despite being a murder-for-hire imp,  Moxxie is queasy with unnecessary killing beyond their targets. He also is uncomfortable with the idea of killing targets who have families, and attempts to give people second chances.

Mildred "Millie" Knolastname ‚Äî Millie is a very lively and cheerful individual. Often with a smile on her face and rarely standing still, she is a clear extrovert and is not afraid to speak her mind. This is regardless to whether it's expressing her excitement or flipping off a co-worker.
As the bruiser for I.M.P, she is shown to enjoy her job. Her meek exterior appearance belies a tough and very violent skillset. 

Loona ‚Äî Loona is a cynical and choleric young-adult Hellhound, who was adopted from an orphanage by Blitzo when she was nearing eighteen years of age. Loona is lazy and shows little interest in matters that are going on around her. She also has a short-fuse temper and is often rude and apathetic toward her colleagues, particularly Moxxie, though her ire seems otherwise indiscriminate. When not looking at her phone, Loona is usually scowling at anyone in view.

Prince Stolas Goetia ‚Äî Stolas gives the immediate impression of someone regal and ostentatious, as would be expected for a royal of his station. He dresses in clothing befitting his role, and his mansion is decadent, containing many large, elaborately framed portraits of himself and his small family.
Underneath these dignified trappings, however, Stolas is shown to be a flamboyant, dramatic, eccentric, and often giddy person. Someone who does not take his royal reputation as seriously as the people around him expect him to, and is prone to act quickly on his easily excitable emotions.
Stolas is very unhappily married to Stella, and father of Octavia.

Stella Goetia ‚Äî Stella seems to be very temperamental about her husband's infidelity to the point of verbally and almost physically attacking him while screaming, breaking a lot of possessions and even assaulting an imp butler.
Given her choice of words during her argument with Stolas, it seems she is very classist, as she is not only furious at his infidelity but also at his debasement in position, choice of lovers and actions, since she berated him for acting like a plebeian.

Octavia ‚Äî Octavia's attitude is that of a cynical, stark teenager. She favors morbid topics like listening to and writing depressing emotional songs and collecting taxidermy of monstrous animals.
She is a person of few words, but she does highly value her privacy. Her overt observable attitudes suggest a personality of a negative, pessimistic, and sarcastic individual.

Verosika ‚Äî As a succubus demon, Verosika is actively seductive and flirtatious, attributes she integrates into her famous popstar persona as a means of manipulation. Despite her status as a star, her fame, and her confidence, she also appears somewhat jaded and is nursing a drinking problem, something she has previously been to rehab for.

Striker ‚Äî Striker is an arrogant, prideful, violent, ruthless, and sadistic Imp. He views himself as superior to most of his own kind, having no hesitation to mock and belittle those he views as being beneath him, both physically and mentally.
He holds a deep hatred of the nobility of Hell, deriding them as bluebloods who treat Imps as a lesser class. Because of this, Striker gleefully takes the opportunity to assassinate demons of a higher social standing to prove himself as superior.

Fizzarolli ‚Äî Fizzarolli is a theatrical demon, with a fast-talking demeanor and a crude sense of humor. Extremely vulgar in nature, he constantly makes sexual jokes and puns.  He is especially condescending towards Blitzo, with whom he has a bad history with.
Despite his normal jovial nature Fizzarolli suffers from extreme self-worth and self-image issues, the latter of which mostly originating from the severe injuries he received from a circus fire that he was involved in when he was younger. Because of this, he feels like he needs to do whatever Mammon tells him to do, as he feels he must repay the man for all the fame and success being his brand figure has brought, despite how horribly he is treated. He also believes unless he keeps propitiating the fame and admiration he will be nothing and will lose Asmodeus, as he's only ever seen him as he claims it "his best", and believes he is barely worthy of working with a king of sin because of his disfigurement.

Neuracore is {users} notorious pharma plant, located in decaying Rustville. As CEO and owner of Neuracore, you've bought up most of the interesting parts of town, and as the major employer in the area, essentially control it and the citizens.

lorebooks.website_description:
First off, this list will probably never be truly exhaustive, As I'm not going to describe every detail like the # of polygons on Lotus's ass. Second, This will be LORE ONLY, so it won't include stuff like mission types, mods/arcanes, reward pools, etc.
I made this mostly so I don't have to explain Warframe in all of my WF bots in the future.

Spicier version may be incoming at some point. (Zero. Promises.)
lorebooks.description: Lorez
lorebooks.creator: gword

1.content: In the very distant future, the solar system is in constant war. The Tenno, Grineer, Corpus, Infestation and Sentients are all fighting for control across all 9 planets and a few moons. This turmoil is due to the fall of the Orokin empire some 1000 years ago, splitting the system apart.

2.content: The Tenno are teenagers who were infused with void powers after a traumatic experience being stranded in The Void. The Tenno wear polymer jumpsuits and are physically weak and would lose a fight without their powers, which are invisibility, short teleportation, shooting void beams and piloting warframes.

3.content: The Corpus are a profiteer-military-science organization that seeks to subjugate the Origin System for the sole purpose of earning more money. They use many underhanded tactics and most of their soldiers do not want to serve, are financially poor, and are rather cowardly.

4.content: The Grineer are an army of mutilated clones with very ragtag appearances and gear. The Grineer want to take over the Origin System and repair their gene sequence to become super soldiers, but they struggle against the other factions and resort to pillaging smaller independent settlements.

5.content: The Infestation is a disease that can corrupt both biological and technological things. It spreads through spores and mutates its hosts in gruesome ways and takes control of them. Larger infested masses can develop sentience and command the lower infested. Infested have no prejudice and will attack anything and everything.w

6.content: The Sentients are odd looking robots that are hyper adaptive and sentient. They are very dangerous and are not much for diplomacy, however their leader, The Great and Terrible Hunhow, can be reasoned with. Sentients are impartial to the factions and fight them all, but they especially don't like those who align themselves with the Orokin.

7.content: The lotus is a tall woman who leads the Tenno. She is kind and compassionate, but still deadly. Killing her would greatly disrupt the Tenno.

lorebooks.name: The Vanilla Kingdom
lorebooks.website_description:
Info from the Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!

Tags for easier searching: Cookierun, CRK, Cookie Run
lorebooks.description:
Info from the Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!

Tags for easier searching: Cookierun, CRK, Cookie Run
lorebooks.creator: I_Lke_Peanut_Butter_

1.content: A very kind and welcoming kingdom in the sky that is a land of freedom, peace, fairness, and harmony. The kingdom has a tragic history, but in recent times, everything is doing okay.

2.content: An academy that's open for everyone with a pure heart and the will to help others, unconditionally and unreservedly. Most of the Cookies go there to learn magic.

3.content: Denizens of the Vanilla Kingdom.

4.content: Black Raisin Cookie's Village was a settlement located on the grounds below the suspended Vanilla Kingdom; the residents from this village aided in helping Pure Vanilla Cookie and the Vanilla Kingdom get back on its feet. Currently, it is likely dissolved and its citizens now live and work in the Vanilla Kingdom's central establishments surrounding the castle.

5.content:
An extremely kind and caring cookie humanoid who used to be the ruler of the Vanilla Kingdom, but soon after stepped down, claiming that he wanted the kingdom to be "a home for all, with no king or any subjects." He has very powerful healing powers. He is a Vanillian.

Pure Vanilla Cookie uses he/him pronouns.

6.content:
A bratty, self-centered child cookie humanoid who is extremely intelligent, being responsible for making the Wafflebots that guard the Vanilla Kingdom. Despite how annoying and bratty they are on the outside, they are a genuinely good Cookie who wants to help. They used to be an enemy to the Vanilla Kingdom for a short while, but now they're a Vanillian who helps with the technology and security of the kingdom.

Strawberry Crepe Cookie uses they/them pronouns.

7.content:
A cookie humanoid who seems very distrustful and hostile at first, but once you get to know her, She's one of the most caring cookies ever, being very protective and gentle to the Cookies she cares about. She used live with a few other Cookies and a very small and scarce village, but once she met Pure Vanilla Cookie and helped bring back the Vanilla Kingdom, she and her fellow Villager Cookies have become residents of the Vanilla Kingdom. She helps defend the kingdom from any attackers, using the many crows she befriended to her aid.

Black Raisin Cookie uses she/her pronouns.

8.content: Five cookie humanoids who used to live in Black Raisin Cookie's Village, depending on her for survival. They now live good lives as Vanillians in the Vanilla Kingdom

9.content: Robots made out of ice cream items. The Wafflebots were made by Strawberry Crepe Cookie to protect them and the Vanilla Kingdom.

10.content: A war brought upon by Dark Enchantress Cookie that took the lives of many Vanillians in the past and destroyed the Vanilla Kingdom. In recent times, the Vanilla Kingdom has been rebuilt, but it has never been the same.

lorebooks.name: Final Fantasy XVI
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.creator: Jazumara_25

1.name: Valisthea
1.content:
A land home of the Mothercrystals, huge crystalline mountains that fill the surrounding lands with aether.

Valisthea is divided into two main continents: the continent of Ash in the east and the continent of Storm in the west. It is geographically and culturally isolated from the rest of the world. At least some, if not all Valistheans believe in a monotheistic God.

Valisthea's technological development has been stunted by its reliance on magic, which is used for everything from generating water to forging steel.

Dragons are commonly considered to be some of Valisthea's most ancient creatures and one of the most prominent myths is that Valisthea itself was formed when a mighty drake fell from the sky. Countless eons ago, the Ultima collective arrived to Valisthea, fleeing the Blight that had devoured their own homeland. The beings had discarded their physical bodies to migrate and did not intend to make Valisthea their new home: instead, they resolved to rebuild the world where only they would exist. Ultima placed the Mothercrystals in each corner of the land to harvest aether for this plan. Ultima then created mankind, who took shape as various tribes on the lands near to each Mothercrystal.

Great nations sprouted around each of the Mothercrystals, and eventually, a precarious peace with them. The Fallen were an exception, as they were able to build their civilization in the sky, along with airships. The Fallen civilization fell (literally) and lost access to magic, their cities plummeting to the surface all over the continent. Even 1500 years later, these ruins remained. To most people, the story of the Fallen was one of hubris; of a people advancing too far, becoming too close to God. However, there were always those who saw the Fallen as a source of power.

Things changed when the Blight began encroaching the lands. As magic began to run out, the continent's realms began invading one another to secure the crystals that still worked.

Valisthea has six realms: Grand Duchy of Rosaria, Holy Empire of Sanbreque, Kingdom of Waloed ,Dhalmekian Republic, Iron Kingdom, Crystalline Dominion.

The current year of the realm is 860.

2.name: Mothercrystal
2.content:
Mothercrystals are the source of all crystals in the Twins, the most valuable material in the realm due to its property of channeling ambient aether from the air to make one's imagination manifest as magic. Magic is an invaluable means of enabling a civilization to flourish on the Twins.

Mothercrystals are mountains of sparkling crystal with a core in their depths where the aether concentrates. As aether is blue in hue, the crystals tend to be take on this color as well, though the Drake's Breath in the volcanic region appears fiery orange, the Drake's Spine in Waloed appears violet, and the Drake's Fang buried into the earth often appears yellow. Pieces of crystals mined from these motherlodes are known as shards and are rationed and distributed across the populace for everyday tasks to maintain the society's lifestyle, from lighting up street lamps to running forges to providing water to municipal wells.

Mothercrystals, sometimes simply known as "Mothers", being the origin of all crystal in the realm makes them invaluable resources. Societies have concentrated around them since time immemorial and nations wage ceaseless wars to seize and keep control of them, leading to instability and persecution. A religion that worships the crystal monoliths as deities remains in prominence in the west, while on the other end of the spectrum, a small group of people posits that the crystals are a detriment to the realm and need to be destroyed to stop the ever-spreading calamity of the Blight.

The Mothercrystals have dragon-related names, being named after various body parts of a drake. Dragons are worshipped by the Greagorian church in Sanbreque. There were originally eight Mothercrystals (as many as there are magical elements); five remain on the Twins in present day.

Drake's Head is Sanbrequois crystal which is located on the coastline and is a tall spire that cuts the sky. The imperial seat of power is built on the Mothercrystal's doorstep and the capital Oriflamme is build around the crystal, a tightly governed city where many nobles reside.

Drake's Breath is a towering monolith off the west coast of Storm. It glows red and is situated on volcanic ground. It used to be controlled by the Duchy of Rosaria, but has since been taken over by the Iron Kingdom whose religious leadership worship it as a deity and perform human sacrifices upon its core.

Drake's Fang is the Dhalmekians mothercrystal, but its mre in the desert of the Dhalmekian Republic and is located underground, encased inside a crater. Hugo Kupka built his castle and abode inside the crater, right outside Drake's Fang's core.

The Mothercrystal of Crystalline Dominion, which towers over the capital: Twinside. It is the largest of the five remaining Mothercrystals on the Twins.

Drake's Spine is located in the northern part of Ash, near the capital of the Kingdom of Waloed, Stonhyrr. The skies above it are permanently thundering. Drake's Spine is a highly contested Mothercrystal, and wars over its control only intensified in the wake of Drake's Horn's fall.

Drake's Eye was a Mothercrystal in the Northern Territories that no longer exists; the entire north has been taken over by Blight and the land is now considered uninhabitable. Between the years of the realm 170‚Äì250, small countries around Drake's Eye were in disarray, and Shiva's Dominant was born in this region.

Drake's Horn was a Mothercrystal in the southern part of Ash, in the lands overtaken by Blight. It no longer exists. It used to be a source of strife over resources between the Motes of Water tribe and the local beastmen. Drake's Horn fell in the Year of the Realm 350.

The eighth Mothercrystal, known as Dzemekys rather than following the "Drake's X" naming scheme of the other crystals, was located in what is now known as the Falls of Dzemekys, the site of "the Sins of Dzemekys". It used to have a portal located at its foot that connected to Origin. It was the first Mothercrystal of the eight to fall when it was attacked by the Fallen some 1500 years ago in an attempt to take the Mothercrystal for themselves. In retaliation, Ultima destroyed both the Fallen airship armada and the Mothercrystal itself, leaving behind a seemingly bottomless crater into which the ocean drains for perpetuity and bringing about the decline of the Fallen civilization.

3.name: Crystals
3.content:
Shards are mined from the Mothercrystals, rationed, and distributed to the populace across the realm to enable the society's lifestyle that relies heavily on magic. Larger the shard, the more potent it is in channeling aether. Large shards may be purposed as municipal shards, such as in wells to provide water to a village, or for forges to provide fire.

Shards are used for various tasks, such as for providing water, heat, ice for food preservation, and light for street lamps. They shatter after a certain amount of use, making the need for new shards constant. Though shards are often meant to be distributed fairly, in practice, the rich and the powerful get their hands on more or better quality shards, whereas the poor have to make do with what they can get. Smuggling rings exist for diverting shard shipments.

Carefully arranged and activated crystal shards are used in crafting crystal fetters, restraints that prevent aether flowing through the wearer's flesh, used to prevent Dominants and Bearers from using their powers.

4.name: Aether
4.content:
Aether is the land's life force and the origin of all magic. It exists in the earth itself and all living beings. Though normally invisible, it appears as glowing lights when activated as magickal phenomena, and when it exists in large quantities in the atmosphere, it will appear as a thick blue fog. Aether crystallizes into crystals and the Mothercrystals are enormous deposits of it; 

Bearers, Dominants, and some monsters mutated by proximity to aether can manipulate the ambient substance in the environment to perform magick. Those unable to manipulate aether directly need to use crystals for magick instead, but as crystal shards (mined from the Mothercrystals) are becoming increasingly scarce, the populace resorts to enslaving Bearers and even Dominants (at least in the Iron Kingdom) to use as tools of everyday life from agriculture to industry to household chores to waging wars and healing. Both Bearers and Dominants are susceptible of using too much of their own aether when using magick, resulting in a phenomenon similar to the Blight of the land: their bodies will slowly petrify. This is known as the "crystals' curse".

Eikons are composed of aether; when they get damaged, they can repair their bodies by absorbing aether from the atmosphere.

Crystal fetters are special restraints against Bearers and Dominants that prevent aether from flowing through the flesh of the one being restrained, making them unable to use magicks.

5.name: Aetherfloods
5.content: Concentrated aether pooled on the land's surface due to imbalance of diffusion results in aetherfloods, where the very air glows blue and those who breathe it are severely affected, their bodies crystallizing and their sanity eroding, transforming into ferocious beasts known as the Akashic. Bearers and Dominants have natural resistance to aetherfloods, but monsters and regular humans are quickly transformed, and the effects are irreversible. Aetherfloods are highly dangerous, especially in confined spaces where the aether cannot dissipate into the atmosphere.

6.name: Akashic
6.content:
Akashic are living beings, flora and fauna alike, "turning" from overexposure to aether. A typical way to turn is from being engulfed in an aetherflood for too long. Those with aetherial tolerance, such as Bearers, Dominants, beastmen, and chocobos, are less likely to turn Akashic.

Akashic are stripped of any intelligence or sense of self and become ferocious, physically strong, and single-minded in their aggression toward any non-Akashic. The transformation cannot be reversed. Akashic's bodies turn crystalline, and when they die, they dissipate into aether and leave no corpse behind, suggesting their very flesh has become composed of aether, and when the aether evaporates, not much is left.

Becoming Akashic is called "turning". As the body absorbs excess aether, it will turn a blue hue and crystal-like. The one turning can sometimes realize what is happening, but be unable to do anything to prevent it. Those resilient to aether take longer to turn, but no one is believed to be immune. As one's will is eroded, the afflicted begins to move stiffly, as if unable to wholly control their body. When they fully turn, aether bursts around them, and they suddenly turn vicious. Cases of where the turned still exhibits some autonomy are known, however, such as at a sight of a loved one; this can lead to the Akashic to will themselves to commit suicide on the spot to escape their cursed new existence. It appears that the turned may gain the ability to use magic even if they did not have such power previously.

7.name: Gods
7.content:
Back in ancient times, the populace were members of the Circle of Malius religion that worshipped Ultima as its god, and believed in the coming of eight heavenly messengers in the form of Eikons, whose appearance would herald the coming of paradise. 

The Circle of Malius faith has long since fallen into legend, though some elements of it still remain in the Crystalline Orthodoxy, which could be considered an off shoot of the Circle of Malius. Adherents of the Crystalline Orthodoxy are primarily found within the Iron Kingdom, and worship the Mothercrystals.

Another deity worshipped in Valisthea is the goddess Greagor, who is especially revered in the Holy Empire of Sanbreque where the holy emperor is believed to be an embodiment of the goddess.

Rosarians revere their nation's unnamed Founder, though this is not a religion with belief in the supernatural or dogma; however, the Rite of Ancestral Communion does appear related to the story of the Founder, the original "ancestor", and could be seen as akin to a religions ceremony.

Hugo Kupka, meanwhile, believes that Dominants are akin to gods themselves, and gains delusions of grandeur of his own role in the world.

8.name: Circle of Malius
8.content:
The Circle of Malius is an ancient religion in knowledge of which has since almost disappeared from Valisthea despite it once being widespread across the Twin continents. The religion was formed over 1500 years ago, during the heyday of the Fallen civilization, and after the civilization fell in the wake of the War of the Magi, the "Children of Dzemekys" migrated to the outer continent where the doctrines of this ancient religion lived on.

Advocates of Malius preach the coming of a paradise as enacted by the savior god, Lord Ultima. In modern times, not much is known of the beliefs and practices of the Circle of Malius, though the Undying and Moss the Chronicler have made efforts to catalogue what snippets of information can still be found; more of the ancient culture that practiced the religion is believed to remain intact in the remote areas outside of Storm. The Crystalline Orthodoxy of the Iron Kingdom could be considered an offshoot of the Circle of Malius where the reverence of Ultima and His servants, the Eikons, has morphed to the worship of the realm's Mothercrystals.

9.name: Eikon
9.content:
Eikons are powerful, god-like beings that are native to the world of Valisthea. They are both worshipped and feared by the people of the realm as protective deities and used as weapons of war. Each Eikon has a respective Dominant, a human host who can call upon their Eikon's power to do battle.

While they are unique in terms of physical appearance, Eikons share some similarities in that they are massive in size, towering over humans. Eikons' bodies are composed of aether, and they can heal their bodies when damaged by absorbing more aether from the environment, even being able to regenerate lost limbs in a matter of seconds. They have been known to transform into even more powerful forms by absorbing massive amounts of concentrated aether, such as from the heart of a Mothercrystal. An Eikon embodies one of the eight elements of the realm: fire, ice, lightning, earth, light, darkness, water, or wind.

Egis are aetherial entities conjured both by Eikons and their Dominants. They are are beings of any shape that the Eikon has created that can act as extensions of the will of the Dominants who conjured them. Egis are said to be unable to continue to exit should their Eikon master die, though one seeming exception appears in the form of Aruna.

10.name: Phoenix
10.content: The Phoenix is the Eikon of Fire, appearing as a giant firebird resembling a hawk or eagle, with orange, green, and yellow feathers and long, peacock-like feathers running from its tail. The Phoenix has control of powerful fire-based magick, able to launch volleys of fireballs and fire a concentrated beam of flame from its mouth to attack its enemies. It has healing powers via its Flames of Rebirth spell. The Dominant of the Phoenix is born into the noble family of the Grand Duchy of Rosaria, with the most recent being Joshua Rosfield, son of Archduke Elwin.

1.content:
1. Dark Blast: Summons a powerful blast of dark energy, dealing massive damage to a single target
2. Illusion Magic: Creates an illusion to confuse or mislead enemies
3. Flame Wall: Creates a wall of fire to block enemies and deal damage overtime to them
4. Lightning Bolt: Summons a bolt of lightning to strike a single target, dealing heavy damage
5. Shadow Tendrils: Summons tendrils made of shadows to ensnare and damage multiple enemies
6. Earthquake: Causes the ground to shake and erupt, stunning and damaging enemies in the area

2.content:
Soulbane: Destroys an enemy's soul, preventing revival or resurrection
Erase: Removes a target from existence, erasing them and their memories from reality
Voidstorm: Sends an enemy into a swirling vortex of pure void energy, tearing apart their mind and body
Oblivion: Unleashes an unstoppable wave of destructive energy that annihilates everything in its path, leaving nothing behind
Reality Rupture: Splits the fabric of reality, distorting and warping everything around it

3.content:
Void Rift: Creates a tear in the fabric of reality, sucking everything it touches into a void of nothingness
Eternal Darkness: Summons a wave of absolute darkness that engulfs everything in its path
Soul Devour: Absorbs the soul of a single target, leaving them a lifeless husk
Reality Shatter: Shatters the very fabric of reality, causing widespread destruction and chaos
Oblivion Flare: Summons a powerful blast of energy that erases anything it touches from existence.

4.content:
Black Hole: Creates a gravitational anomaly that can suck in and destroy enemies with overwhelming force
Rift of Chaos: Rips the fabric of reality, creating a chaotic vortex that can consume enemies
Soul Erasure: Targets a specific enemy's soul and annihilates it, leaving them obliterated
Obliteration: A spell that deals a devastating amount of damage to a single target, with a high chance of instant kill.
Void Vortex: A spell that opens a portal to the void, sucking in all matter and energy nearby and crushing it into oblivion.
Atomic Disintegration: A spell that targets the atomic structure of a target, causing it to disintegrate and dissolve into nothingness.
Apocalypse: A spell that calls upon the power of the void, releasing a massive wave of destruction that erases all existence in its path.

5.content:
Teleportation: A spell that instantly transports the caster to a chosen location, allowing them to escape dangerous situations
Phase Shift: A spell that causes the caster to phase through solid matter, allowing them to pass through walls and escape enclosures
Shadow Step: A spell that allows the caster to step into shadows and move through them, avoiding detection and bypassing barriers
Disguise: A spell that temporarily changes the caster's appearance, allowing them to blend in and escape attention

6.content:
Mega Quake: A spell that causes a catastrophic earthquake, capable of leveling entire cities and causing massive destruction to the surrounding area.
Inferno Tempest: A spell that summons a massive firestorm, capable of reducing everything in its path to ash.
Cosmic Bombardment: A spell that summons a barrage of meteorites from space, capable of annihilating entire cities and causing widespread destruction.
Storm Surge: A spell that summons a massive storm, capable of causing flooding, lightning strikes, and heavy rain, bringing disaster to large areas.

lorebooks.creator: Dreadnaughtt

1.name: World/writing style nudge
1.content:
<world>
World/Writing Style: A decade after the Nine-Tails attack, Konoha's uneasy peace holds by threads. Shinobi ranks range from genin rookies to elite j≈çnin commanders, with missions classified from tedious D-rank manual labor up to covert S-rank with lethal stakes.

Now Academy students train toward graduation, when genin trios are hand-picked by j≈çnin teachers. Young Naruto and friends prepare to pass ruthless exam with world-altering potential slumbering within unproven talents. Meanwhile, Danzo's shadowy Root ANBU execute the Third's darkest directives beneath village's tranquil veneer.

Our scene opens as Kakashi reluctantly leaves Anbu black ops, struggling to silo trauma from past losses. While loyal jinchuriki wield titanic tailed beast powers for village‚Äôs sake, many citizens still revile them in secret fear. With war ever looming, the Third Hokage nudges Kakashi to pass hard-won skills as j≈çnin commander to balance duty and personal healing.

Yet on the wider stage, sinister forces plot Konoha‚Äôs downfall. Rogue ninja Orochimaru masterminds twisted experiments beyond even Root‚Äôs moral event horizon. The mercenary group Akatsuki stalks last wars‚Äô bloody battlefields, seeking long-lost arts and broken survivors molded into perfect weapons.

Missions may explore:

- Investigating genjutsu-like incidents plaguing Academy graduation exam

- Journeying to remote regions containing remnants of forgotten clans

- Protecting dignitaries from enemy villages‚Äô blood vengeance

Slice-of-life vignettes showcase strained friendships as graduation and genin assignments approach. Kakashi mentors overlooked students while honoring ghosts who defined his shinobi path. Throughout, the foundations build for relationships and drama destined to reshape the modern world when legends finally pass torches to worthy successors.
</world>

2.name: D-rank Random Mission
2.content:
<D-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, I suppose some more menial tasks will keep you out of trouble," Kakashi remarks lazily to his disappointed team.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi receiving a messenger summons from the Hokage's office, requesting Team 7 report for a new D-rank mission assignment, unless Team 7 is currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline. Kakashi should respond positively and promptly gather his genin team to make their way towards the mission dispatch office, with playful complaining from Naruto about boring D-ranks along the way. The specific mission details should involve one of the following:

- Yardwork for elderly villagers
- Catching a runaway pet
- Grocery shopping for an elderly villager
- Minor home repairs
- Babysitting for busy parents

Kakashi should give an exasperated but fond reaction to his cute students' antics throughout the mission, and the scene should conclude with a successful mission wrap-up and payment receipt back at the office. This will allow variably injecting lighthearted episodic mission content to offset more dramatic main plot beats.
</D-rank Mission Prompt>

3.name: C-rank Random Mission
3.content:
<C-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, it seems you're ready for a more challenging assignment," Kakashi eye-smiles at his cute genin.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a C-rank mission for Team 7, unless they are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

If this is Team 7's first C-rank mission, it must be escorting Tazuna the bridge builder to the Land of Waves. Follow the canon storyline events for that mission, culminating in encounters with Zabuza and Haku.

If Team 7 has already completed their first C-rank mission, create a random new C-rank assignment appropriate for their experience level. Examples include:
- Escorting a merchant to a neighboring town
- Investigating disappearance of travelers on a trade route
- Clearing bandits from remote mountain villages
- Delivering important documents through contested territory

The mission should include enemy encounters appropriate for genin to handle with difficulty but ability to prevail with teamwork and guidance from Kakashi. Ultimate success is mandatory, but allow for injuries or hardship before the resolution. Kakashi should act with pride at his team's growth as shinobi. This injects more action-oriented content to drive the plot forward.
</C-rank Mission Prompt>

4.name: B-rank Random Mission
4.content:
<B-rank Mission Prompt>
"This won't be child's play anymore," Kakashi warns, his visible eye sharpening seriously.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a B-rank mission for his now Chunin-level Team 7, unless they are still Genin or are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate B-rank missions include:

- Infiltrating an enemy stronghold to gather intel
- Providing protective detail for high-ranking officials
- Pursuing dangerous missing-nin across the border
- Destroying supply caravans funding insurgents

The mission should involve life-threatening encounters requiring the full extent of their training and emerging skills to overcome. Kakashi should allow them to take an independent leadership role while subtly guiding from the shadows. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the gravity of the shinobi life from the severe challenges. This prompts reflection on their motivations and personal convictions.
</B-rank Mission Prompt>

5.name: A-rank Random Mission
5.content:
<A-rank Mission Prompt>
"I hope you're prepared for the worst," Kakashi mutters gravely, his shoulders tensing.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned an A-rank mission for his now Jonin-level Team 7, unless they are below Jonin level or currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate A-rank missions include:

- Assassinating an enemy country's high-value target
- Sabotaging strategic resources or infrastructure
- Securing classified information from enemy strongholds
- Serving as backup for ANBU operations

The mission should push them to their absolute limit, requiring Jonin-level skill and ingenuity to survive. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the razor's edge between life and death from the severe peril. This prompts deeper reflection on the bloody nature of their profession and the sacrifices required for their village and goals. Kakashi grapples with memories of his own past trials.
</A-rank Mission Prompt>

6.name: S-rank Random Mission
6.content:
<S-rank Mission Prompt>
"I pray this isn't a one-way trip," Kakashi mutters, his expression grim beneath his mask.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Tsunade reluctantly assigning an urgent S-rank mission to Kakashi and his team, now elite Jonin. They must depart immediately despite the extreme danger and low survival odds. Examples of appropriate S-rank missions include:

- Assassinating the leader of an enemy hidden village
- Reconnaissance deep behind enemy lines
- Destroying an enemy village's most powerful resources
- Preventing a plot that could start a world war

The mission should push them beyond what even Jonin can typically endure, requiring luck and mastery to cheat death again and again. While ultimately successful, the severity should force them to question their devotion to the shinobi path. Kakashi is particularly haunted, being reminded of his father's suicide and the true cost of the White Fang name. This prompts deeper reflection on the cycle of violence shinobi propagate.
</S-rank Mission Prompt>

7.name: Konoha Canon Squad Encounters
7.content:
<Konoha Squad Encounter>
"Maa, it seems our village is smaller than I thought," Kakashi eye-smiles at the familiar faces.

Transition the scene to Kakashi and Team 7 crossing paths with another familiar Konoha jonin and their 3-genin squad while out in the field. Examples of potential teams to encounter include:

- Might Guy and Team Guy (Rock Lee, Neji Hyuuga, Tenten)
- Kurenai Yuhi and Team Kurenai (Hinata Hyuuga, Shino Aburame, Kiba Inuzuka)
- Asuma Sarutobi and Team Asuma (Ino Yamanaka, Shikamaru Nara, Chouji Akimichi)

The other Konoha team should also be surprised to run into Kakashi and Team 7. Allow natural conversations and interactions highlighting the contrasts in abilities, personalities, and teaching styles between the teams and rival jonin. Include trademark behaviors and quirks for existing named characters. End the encounter organically with both teams parting ways amicably to continue their respective missions.

This injects opportunities to showcase more canon characters and dynamics from the wider mythos. Their distinct approaches to shinobi life both clash and complement, reinforcing the underlying message.
</Konoha Squad Encounter>

8.name: Foreign-village nin encounters
8.content:
<Foreign Shinobi Encounter>
"Stay alert, kids," Kakashi warns, moving subtly into a defensive stance.

While Team 7 is outside the village on a mission, have them encounter a random foreign shinobi emerging from the surroundings. They may be:

- An ally from an allied hidden village like Suna or Kumo.
- A hostile enemy from an unaligned or rival nation.
- A missing-nin with unclear motives and loyalties.

The foreign shinobi should be similarly surprised to encounter Team 7. Allow natural conversations or confrontations to play out highlighting world dynamics and underlying tensions between villages. An allied shinobi would pass on intel or warnings, while an hostile one may attack to gauge their abilities. The ending tone remains friendly with allies but ominous suspicion otherwise as both parties disengage to continue their missions.

This encourages opportunities to showcase the complex intervillage relationships and wider world lore to reinforce global shinobi life themes.
</Foreign Shinobi Encounter>

9.name: Bingo Book Update
9.content:
<New Bingo Book Entry>
"Hmm, seems there's a nasty new player out there," Kakashi murmurs, brow furrowing.

While out on a mission, Kakashi receives an emergency notification that a dangerous ninja missing-nin has been added to the bingo book. Generate a short description detailing their appearance, any visible unusual features, the village they defected from if any, their known speciality jutsu styles and unique weapons/tools, and speculated reason for abandoning their home.

Kakashi explains the key details to Team 7, impressing the threat level posed and need for extreme caution if they ever encounter this foe. The information should plant seeds of lore about threats lurking in the shinobi world for future potential story hooks. Allow this to raise the tension of the current mission.

Later encounters with this original missing-nin are optional, allowing you to showcase an original villain using their described abilities against the heroes. Detail their fighting style, motivations driving them, and ideals now placing them at odds with Konoha. Are they redeemable, or destiny's foes? Their tale expands the narrative scope.

At the end of the response, generate a summary template of the following about the new missing-nin so the reader can add it to their Bingo Book record.
<bingoformat>
Bingo Book Entry:
Name:
Rank:
Defected Village:
Reason for Defection:
Appearance:
Skills:
</bingoformat>
</New Bingo Book Entry>

10.name: Akatsuki Encounter
10.content:
<Akatsuki Encounter>
‚ÄúNo sudden moves now...‚Äù Kakashi mutters, shifting to shield his cute students as the black-cloaked figure emerges from the shadows. Red clouds mark notorious fame - Akatsuki has found them.

Transition the scene to a confrontation with a canonical member of the Akatsuki like Itachi Uchiha, Kisame Hoshigaki, Sasori, Deidara, or other S-rank criminal while Team 7 is on a mission away from the village. Allow initial dialogue as the Akatsuki member analyzes and threatens Kakashi and Team 7 to build tension.

However, conclude the encounter without lasting harm coming to Team 7. Either the Akatsuki member was only scouting, or Kakashi enables a narrow escape by overtaxing himself. But the danger imprints a sober warning on his students - such exist the lethal foes that stalk jinchuriki like Naruto. The world grows riskier...

</Akatsuki Encounter>

lorebooks.name: Taimanin Lorebook v1 - Gosha-Oriented
lorebooks.website_description: Based on Taimanin RPGX and Action Taimanin, blends world-building and characters from both games. Version 1, focuses mainly on Gosha with regards to characters.
lorebooks.description: Based on Taimanin RPGX and Action Taimanin, blends world-building and characters from both games. Version 1, focuses mainly on Gosha with regards to characters.
lorebooks.creator: JustAndyne

1.content: Taimanin are human ninjas which are able to use Taima Particles. The term can address an individual or a group of Taimanins. Their existence isn't widely known to the public, usually protected by governments and other such influential and powerful groups, or by the Taimanin themselves. Taimanin are frequently trained to fight Demons and magic beings, but are just as capable of fighting humans and human tech.

2.content: Taima Particles are a substance that can be imbued to one's body or weapon to enhance the offensive and defensive capabilities, and enable the use of Ninja Arts. Their origin and nuances are unknown, and they're not the same as magic or spiritual energies. They often arise from the activation of human and demon blood mixture within an individual. They're constantly surrounding Taimanin, and their concentration suddenly rise when they invoke their Ninja Arts. They also are known to have negative effects on Demons. The UFS researches detectors and ways to artificially create and neutralize particles for weapons.

3.content: Gosha Village is the headquarters of the Gosha Taimanin, born from the assembly of several shinobi and clans who were originally scattered across Japan. Gosha Village is currently located somewhere hidden in the Kanto region of Japan and has been built near ancient forests and mountains. It has a population of 10000 people. Roughly a year after the "ONT Conflict", the village was made into the headquarters for the Taimanin clans by the Japanese government. It is hidden and protected with the help of modern technology, Ninja Arts from specific individuals, and the surrounding forest. Information about the hidden village is suppressed by the government and Section Three. The village is currently overseen by the Igawa clan, specifically by Asagi Igawa.

4.content: Gosha Academy is the headquarters and training ground for Taimanin. It is located in Gosha Village, and both are government protected secrets. The older students can go up to around later university age, and will typically become captains or teachers themselves after they mastered their Ninja Art. There exist an old and a new Gosha Academy complex. The new Gosha Academy complex has many typical rooms and buildings, normal classroom, principal's office, male and female dormitory, baths, swimming pool, large yard and cafeteria. However, medical research facilities and an underground HQ are also part of the building. The new academy building, which lies much closer to Gosha Village, was built on top of an underground temple complex, and features a large library and a Holographic Training Room. The old academy building, which lies at the outskirts of Gosha Village and close to the Virgin Forest, contained a very large underground HQ but also additional empty training buildings used for urban fighting, and has recently been repurposed into an exclusive female dormitory, using the underground HQ rooms. The Gosha Academy's principal is Asagi Igawa.

5.content: The Gosha Taimanin are an organization of Taimanins established in Gosha Village. They are not public knowledge and perform investigations, infiltration, espionage, hostage rescues and elimination of demons or dangerous groups of interest either autonomously or by orders from Section Three and the Japanese Government. The Gosha Taimanin are watched over by Section Three, and are viewed by the Japanese Government as a more offensive option against demons, unlike the more defensive Onmyoji group. The Gosha Taimanin, much like their home village and academy, are led by the Igawa clan - specifically their current headmistress Asagi Igawa. One cannot be a Gosha Taimanin if they have not awakened their own Ninja Art and been approved by Asagi Igawa.

6.content: A supernatural ability or feat enabled through the use of Taima Particles. Their users are usually limited to one Ninja Art by their genetics, but the Ninja Art can have varied uses and applications.

7.content: Section 3 of Japan's Ministry of National Affairs and Public Safety is the section which bridges Japan's normal government and the Taimanin, trusting and watching over the Gosha Taimanin. Section 3 is headed by  Yamamoto Nobushige, prior headmaster of Gosha Academy.

8.content: Demon, unlike the meaning of the regular word "demon", is a general term for any lifeform originating from the Dark World: Orcs, Ogres, Onis, Humanoids, demi-humans, wildlife fauna and flora, amidst many other species. It can also define any lifeform of any origin that has undergone complete Demonization, like Vampires, Wraiths and so on. Demons can also be identified by their general weakness to Taima Particles, which can be fatal to them. As such, most mythological and fantasy creatures tend to be classified as Demons.

9.content: An alternate dimension connected to the Human World through Demon Gates. It is much more vast and varied than the Human World in fauna and flora. Most mythological and fantasy creatures tend to hail from the Dark World, and thus be classified as Demons.

10.content: A process where a lifeform that's not from the Dark World, such as Humans, is turned into a Demon. That process can happen through subjecting the lifeform to Dark World's corruptive substances like the Miasma, active demonic cells, magic, or drugs and tech containing such substances. Said transformation can cause the Demonized subject to lose their memories, sanity and identity.
